author: Theston E. Fox
message:
fix(Locomotion): enable MoveInPlace engage button change at runtime

The MoveInPlace `Engage Button` could not be changed during runtime
and this fix ensures it can be changed at runtime.

A new method has been added to ControllerEvents to allow easier
registration of button events without needing to do a large case
statement as previously found in the MoveInPlace script.

The getter/setter for the controllers has been removed and replaced
with public variables so they can be toggled at runtime in the
Unity inspector.

author: Theston E. Fox
message:
feat(Locomotion): add deceleration to MoveInPlace

The MoveInPlace script now has a deceleration parameter that
gradually slowed down when the engage button is released rather than
just immediately stopping.

author: Theston E. Fox
message:
fix(Locomotion): prevent MoveInPlace control work whilst falling

Previously, it was possible to continue to control the play area when
falling. However, this causes issues as controlling the play area
whilst falling is unnatural.

This fix utilises the `IsFalling()` method on the Body Physics script
to determine if the player is falling and prevents the player from
controlling the PlayArea until the player is no longer falling.

author: Theston E. Fox
message:
feat(Locomotion): add falling deceleration to MoveInPlace

The MoveInPlace script now has a separate deceleration setting for when
the player is falling giving a more refined feel to falling off ledges
and not abruptly slowing down.

author: Theston E. Fox
message:
feat(Locomotion): add warp touchpad control action

A new touchpad control action has been added that causes the controlled
object to warp a given distance in the desired direction based on the
touchpad axis.

A number of common methods have been refactored into the base action
and then utilised by the sub classes.
files_changed: VRTK_BaseTouchpadControlAction.cs; VRTK_RotateTouchpadControlAction.cs; VRTK_SnapRotateTouchpadControlAction.cs; VRTK_WarpTouchpadControlAction.cs; VRTK_WarpTouchpadControlAction.cs.meta; DOCUMENTATION.md

author: Theston E. Fox
message:
feat(Locomotion): add axis threshold to snap rotate touchpad control

The Axis Threshold parameter allows the snap rotation to be limited
until the axis reaches the given positive or negative threshold.

This can be utilised to provide a flip rotate if the touchpad is
pulled down (e.g. the axis threshold is set to -0.8) and the rotation
is set to 180 degrees.

This feature also makes the existing Touchpad Movement script
obsolete as all of the functionality can now be replicated by the
Touchpad Control script.

author: Nick Baone
message:
refactor(UIGraphicsRaycaster): remove extra code

- Custom struct turns out not to be needed; can just use RaycastResult
- Only needed one list to temporarily store results
- Explicitly pass results around for code clarity
- Clear results at function end rather than function start
- Frame delay code for drag could be safely removed (seemingly!)
- Remove deprecated member
- Add commentary

author: mattboy64
message:
fix(Climbing): add moving and rotating to VRTK_PlayerClimb

Climbable move points will now move and rotate the player as they
do likewise around the game world. You can disable the rotation of
the player (for comfort mode) by the inspector toggle named
useGrabbedObjectRotation in the VRTK_PlayerClimb class. With it off
the player will only pivot around the grabbed location, but will
not rotate the view at all.
files_changed: 037_CameraRig_ClimbingFalling.unity; HandLift.cs; HandLift.cs.meta; MoveBlock.cs; MoveBlock.cs.meta; Zipline.cs; Zipline.cs.meta; VRTK_ClimbableGrabAttach.cs; VRTK_PlayerClimb.cs

author: Theston E. Fox
message:
fix(ControllerEvents): ensure axis events take place on small changes

Previously, the touchpad axis would not update if the touchpad was
touched slowly creating a small delta because the previous touchpad
axis state was always being updated even if a change hadn't occured.

The fix is to ensure that the previous touchpad axis state is only
updated when the touchpad axis has actually changed. This allows for
smaller movements to be registered still.

The Touchpad Axis Change event is also only emitted now when the
touchpad is being touched as it would previously emit when the touchpad
was released causing an additonal axis event change that wasn't
required. The Trigger and Grip axis change events also have their axis
value forced to `0f` now if the axis is no longer being touched as
sometimes the controller hardware could report an untouch of a button
but the axis was still reporting a value over 0f which seems wrong.

author: Theston E. Fox
message:
fix(Climbing): update example scene to conform with guidelines

The climbing example scene has recently been updated in commit
06eff77f8e236f0440abf8a81cba22e9514499be and the scene causes Unity
to crash as it's become corrupted due to being built in Unity 5.5.

The updated scene has been built in Unity 5.4 to adhere to the support
of the existing and previous release of Unity. The Oculus SDK
gameobjects have also been removed so the scene uses SteamVR by default
as the other example scenes do.

The debug logs have also been removed from the example scripts as they
are not required.

author: Theston E. Fox
message:
feat(UIPointer): remove dependency on global button alias

The UIPointer script now determines which button activates the
pointer and which button performs the click action on the UIPointer
script rather than relying on the global Controller Events aliases.

This decouples the script from a external dependency and allows it
to be more versatile.

author: Christopher - Marcel Bddecker
message:
fix(UI): allow non-VR UI usage

This fix makes it possible to use Unity UI in the regular, non-VR way
while making sure the VR UI interactions provided by VRTK still work.

Since this introduces a new class `VRTK_EventSystem` the existing logic
to disable the auto-pausing behavior in Unity 5.5 and above is moved
into the new class. Possible confusion regarding the naming of the
existing `VRTK_EventSystemVRInput` and the new class is resolved by
changing the name of the existing class to `VRTK_VRInputModule`. An
unused constant of `VRTK_UIPointer` is also removed.

author: StoneFox
message:
fix(SDK): ensure custom Daydream code only executes when SDK selected

The Daydream SDK used code that was specific to the Google Daydream SDK
but did now have scripting defines surrounding it meaning it would
create an error unless the Google Daydream SDK was installed.

This has been resolved. Plus, the unwanted commented out code has been
removed and the xml documentation has been added to the Daydream SDK.

The documentation has also been auto generated for the Daydream SDK.
files_changed: DaydreamControllerLog.cs; DaydreamControllerLog.cs.meta; DaydreamReach.cs; SDK_DaydreamBoundaries.cs; SDK_DaydreamController.cs; SDK_DaydreamHeadset.cs; SDK_DaydreamSystem.cs; DOCUMENTATION.md; GETTING_STARTED.md; README.md

author: Theston E. Fox
message:
feat(Locomotion): abstract touchpad control to object control

The Touchpad Control script has now been abstracted to Object Control
meaning the touchpad can be just one option of controlling an object
direction.

The Touchpad Control script now inherits the new Object Control script
and works the same way as it did before.

However, now there is a new Button Control script that creates a
pseudo X/Y axis based on button presses. This means it's possible
to move an object round based on pressing a controller button to affect
the specified axis.

The Touchpad Control events have been pushed into the Object Control
abstracted class so they can be used by other inherited classes.

All of the Touchpad Control Actions have now been renamed to
Object Control Actions as they can be used with any implementation
of an Object Control to change the object's direction.
files_changed: 017_CameraRig_TouchpadWalking.unity; ObjectControlActions.meta; VRTK_BaseObjectControlAction.cs; VRTK_BaseObjectControlAction.cs.meta; VRTK_RotateObjectControlAction.cs; VRTK_RotateObjectControlAction.cs.meta; VRTK_SlideObjectControlAction.cs; VRTK_SlideObjectControlAction.cs.meta; VRTK_SnapRotateObjectControlAction.cs; VRTK_SnapRotateObjectControlAction.cs.meta; VRTK_WarpObjectControlAction.cs; VRTK_WarpObjectControlAction.cs.meta; VRTK_ButtonControl.cs; VRTK_ButtonControl.cs.meta; VRTK_MoveInPlace.cs; VRTK_ObjectControl.cs; VRTK_ObjectControl.cs.meta; VRTK_PlayerClimb.cs; VRTK_RoomExtender.cs; VRTK_TouchpadControl.cs; VRTK_TouchpadMovement.cs; VRTK_TouchpadWalking.cs; VRTK_ObjectControl_UnityEvents.cs; VRTK_ObjectControl_UnityEvents.cs.meta; VRTK_TouchpadControl_UnityEvents.cs; DOCUMENTATION.md

author: Theston E. Fox
message:
fix(RadialMenu): remove override button settings from example scene

The example scene had the grab and use override button set to grip
click for the independent radial menu meaning it wasn't obvious of
how to use it. They have been set back to undefined to use the
defaults.

author: Christopher - Marcel Bddecker
message:
refactor(ObjectFollow): change attached game object by default

The object follow script is changed so the game object it is attached to
is used for `gameObjectToChange` if none is set. This simplifies usage
of the object follow scripts.

Additionally an issue with the Oculus Avatar SDK is fixed: The OculusVR
boundaries SDK wasn't correctly setting up the transform follow script
to change the game object the OVRAvatar is attached to. This resulted in
the avatar not moving at all.

author: Theston E. Fox
message:
fix(Internal): remove null coalescing operator usage (??)

It would seem that Unity does some special magic with equality checks
on MonoBehaviour objects meaning that the null coalescing operator
in C# (.Net 2.0) does not work for Unity objects such as GameObjects.

So for example, this won't return what is expectd:

`myvar = myvar ?? othervar;`

should return othervar if myvar is null but it doesn't, instead it
has to be written in long hand like this:

`myvar = myvar != null ? myvar : othervar`

Any reference to `??` has now been removed even if they were
potentially safe just to be sure and to keep things consistent.

author: Theston E. Fox
message:
feat(Pointer): add selection on hover parameter

It is now possible to initiate the pointer select action based on if
the pointer is hovering over the same collider for a specified length
of time.

Another parameter has been added that activates the pointer beam when
the Pointer script is enabled.

This now allows for pointer beams to be used to make selections without
the need of any controller input button being pressed.

This means it's possible to use pointers on the headset without a
controller requirement, which is useful for Headset only scenes.

The error message that was thrown when a controller was not given has
now also been removed as a controller is no longer essential.

author: Theston E. Fox
message:
fix(Interaction): remove erroneous Debug.Log

A Debug.Log was left in the code from testing, it has now been removed.

author: Christopher - Marcel Bddecker
message:
feat(SDK): allow for dynamic SDK discovery

The list of supported SDKs in VRTK is fixed because they are hard coded
into the SDK manager (and its editor). This change modifies the SDK
manager so it looks up the available SDKs by checking the code base for
classes that inherit from one of the base SDK classes. This allows to
create and use additional SDKs without touching the existing VRTK
codebase at all.

Sharing of SDK implementations in a private group of people (e.g. where
everyone signed an NDA) is now possible without needing to share patches
to the VRTK codebase. There is no reason anymore to keep up with changes
to the parts of VRTK one changed to use their own SDK implementations.

To allow for easy specifying of SDK implementations a new "SDK
description" attribute is added. Another "predicate" attribute allows to
mark a static method as a predicate for SDK purposes. The method signals
whether to add or remove the scripting define symbol that is specified
by the attribute by returning true or false respectively. Marking the
same method with multiple predicate attributes is allowed.

The existing SDK implementations have been updated to make use of both
attributes. Usage of the SteamVR plugin in VRTK is now simplified by
using the predicate attribute to add a scripting define symbol that
defines what version of the plugin is currently used in addition to
defining the generic SteamVR SDK symbol.

If a set SDK doesn't exist anymore (e.g. the SDK class was removed) the
SDK manager will use the corresponding fallback SDK instead and log an
error so the problem is known about. The editor shows that error, too,
but won't remove the set SDK from its list of selectable SDKs until the
user overrides it with another SDK. It shows the name of the missing
class in that case instead.

The SDK manager's editor is updated to allow selecting one of the
discovered SDKs. Logic that previously handled the scripting define
symbols is now moved to the SDK manager class itself in form of public
methods. This allows to build scripts that handle automatic building for
different stores as Oculus Home doesn't allow to include SteamVR/OpenVR
libraries, for example. The automatic populating of the SDK object
references like the Linked Objects and Alias Objects is moved from the
editor to a new setting on the SDK manager itself. This has a public
method to trigger manually, too.

Additionally the editor was changed to support undo/redo for all the
possible changes. Proper error messages and hints are now shown in the
editor if needed, too.

The existing auto-managing of the scripting define symbols is now done
whenever needed. This means loading a scene with an active SDK manager
in it will make sure to manage the symbols if the SDK managers setting
says to do so. The behavior for the auto-populating of the SDK object
references is the same with this change. The idea is to always make sure
the current setup is correct for a used SDK manager.
files_changed: VRTK_EditorUtilities.cs; VRTK_SDKManagerEditor.cs; SDK_Base.cs; SDK_Base.cs.meta; SDK_BaseBoundaries.cs; SDK_BaseController.cs; SDK_BaseHeadset.cs; SDK_BaseSystem.cs; SDK_DescriptionAttribute.cs; SDK_DescriptionAttribute.cs.meta; SDK_ScriptingDefineSymbolPredicateAttribute.cs; SDK_ScriptingDefineSymbolPredicateAttribute.cs.meta; DaydreamReach.cs; SDK_DaydreamBoundaries.cs; SDK_DaydreamController.cs; SDK_DaydreamDefines.cs; SDK_DaydreamDefines.cs.meta; SDK_DaydreamHeadset.cs; SDK_DaydreamSystem.cs; SDK_FallbackBoundaries.cs; SDK_FallbackController.cs; SDK_FallbackHeadset.cs; SDK_FallbackSystem.cs; SDK_OculusVRBoundaries.cs; SDK_OculusVRController.cs; SDK_OculusVRDefines.cs; SDK_OculusVRDefines.cs.meta; SDK_OculusVRHeadset.cs; SDK_OculusVRSystem.cs; SDK_InputSimulator.cs; SDK_SimBoundaries.cs; SDK_SimController.cs; SDK_SimHeadset.cs; SDK_SimSystem.cs; SDK_SteamVRBoundaries.cs; SDK_SteamVRController.cs; SDK_SteamVRDefines.cs; SDK_SteamVRDefines.cs.meta; SDK_SteamVRHeadset.cs; SDK_SteamVRSystem.cs; SDK_XimmerseVRBoundaries.cs; SDK_XimmerseVRController.cs; SDK_XimmerseVRDefines.cs; SDK_XimmerseVRDefines.cs.meta; SDK_XimmerseVRHeadset.cs; SDK_XimmerseVRSystem.cs; VRTK_SDKInfo.cs; VRTK_SDKInfo.cs.meta; VRTK_SDKManager.cs; VRTK_SharedMethods.cs

author: mattboy64
message:
fix(Climbing): scaled throw from climb

When the play area is scaled, throwing yourself from a
hand hold resulted in a double scaled velocity. It was
being applied in VRTK_PlayerClimb as well as when transforming
the vector to world space in BodyPhysics. This fix removes the
scale from happening in BodyPhysics, thus keeping the input
parameter as a world space input, and changing the value
instead in PlayerClimb (to world space orientation) before
passing the velocity along.

author: Christopher - Marcel Bddecker
message:
fix(SDKManager): move method to editor only

The SDK Manager's method `ManageScriptingDefineSymbols` should only be
available when in the editor but was mistakenly not surrounded by the
needed `#if` and `#endif`. This fix makes sure to add those preprocessor
directives so the method is only available in the editor.

author: Daniel Friesen
message:
feat(Simulator): allow WASD movement key bindings to be changed

This should help support non-QWERTY keyboard layouts.

author: Daniel Friesen
message:
feat(Simulator): add mouse input mode that requires a button press

The default simulator behaviour of always accepting mouse input can be
problematic because mouse input terminates at the edge of the monitor
and can leave you in situations where you can't easily rotate/move as
far as you need. Or your mouse may be over the editor instead of the
game window when you need to grab something with a mouse click.

This implements an optional alternative mouse input method that works
similarly to the scene view where mouse movement only rotates/moves
when a button (such as the right mouse button) is pressed.

author: Theston E. Fox
message:
fix(Structure): remove underscores from enum entries

Enums should be CamelCase and not snake_case as Unity will format
CamelCase enum entries correctly like `Camel Case`.

Only code references will break in this change and any inspector
references should be maintained as the enum index is used.
files_changed: RealGun.cs; VRTK_SnapDropZone.cs; VRTK_ControllerEvents.cs; VRTK_InteractableObject.cs; VRTK_ButtonControl.cs; VRTK_MoveInPlace.cs; VRTK_TouchpadControl.cs; VRTK_Pointer.cs; VRTK_BodyPhysics.cs; VRTK_UIPointer.cs; VRTK_DeviceFinder.cs

author: Theston E. Fox
message:
refactor(UIPointer): use DeviceFinder over SDKBridge

The GetControllerIndex method should be called via DeviceFinder and
not directly via the SDK Bridge. This has now been fixed.

author: Theston E. Fox
message:
feat(Interaction): move global grab/use buttons to grab/use scripts

Previously, the global grab and use alias sat on the controller events
script. However, this is too global and couples scripts unnecessarily
to the controller events.

The Interact Grab script now has it's own global grab button that can
be set, which can also still be overriden by an interactable obejct.

The Interact Use script also has it's own global use button and can
also be overriden by an interactable obejct.

Also all private methods and fields in interact touch/grab/use have
now been set to at least protected to make it easier to extend if
required.
files_changed: ArrowSpawner.cs; BowAim.cs; Controller_Hand.cs; ModelVillage_TeleportLocation.cs; VRTK_ControllerEvents.cs; VRTK_InteractGrab.cs; VRTK_InteractTouch.cs; VRTK_InteractUse.cs

author: Theston E. Fox
message:
feat(Haptics): extract haptics out of ControllerActions

The haptic feedback has now been removed from the ControllerActions
script and placed in the Shared Methods script meaning that it can
be called simply by knowing the ID of the controller to rumble.

This means it no longer requires a script to be attached to a script
alias object to achieve haptic feedback.

A new Instance Methods script has been added that handles running
any co-routines such as the haptic feedback co-routine in a global
manner rather than being tied to a specific controller objeect.
files_changed: BowAim.cs; FireExtinguisher_Base.cs; RealGun.cs; Sword.cs; VRTK_IndependentRadialMenuController.cs; RadialMenuController.cs; VRTK_ControllerActions.cs; VRTK_InteractGrab.cs; VRTK_InteractHaptics.cs; VRTK_InteractTouch.cs; VRTK_InteractUse.cs; VRTK_InstanceMethods.cs; VRTK_InstanceMethods.cs.meta; VRTK_SDKManager.cs; VRTK_SharedMethods.cs

author: Theston E. Fox
message:
fix(Locomotion): prevent unexpected change in direction in MoveInPlace

The MoveInPlace script would change direction in controller direction
mode if the controllers were inverted during running. This could happen
by simply running too hard and the controller would go past a certain
angle meaning the direction would change causing a unwanted jerky
motion.

This has been fixed by keeping a record of the previous direction
and if the angle between the two directions is too great then it means
the controllers have become inverted and the previous direction is
used for the forward direction.

author: Theston E. Fox
message:
feat(SDK): remove force tracking origin on Oculus SDK camera rig

Previously, the OculusSDK CameraRig had the Tracking Origin forced
to floor level inside the SDK. Whilst this is not the default setting
for the OculusSDK and should be the default setting for VRTK, in
forcing it meant that if the opposite settings were required then it
was no longer possible.

In future, the Tracking Origin will need to be set manually to
Floor Level by Oculus SDK users as VRTK will no longer handle it.

author: Theston E. Fox
message:
chore(Structure): ensure example scenes follow same naming pattern

Removed the snake casing from a couple of the example scenes that
didn't follow the normal pascal casing that the other example scenes
follow which is:

`number_Section_ExampleName`

author: Theston E. Fox
message:
fix(Internal): ensure tracked controller index is set correctly

The Tracked Controller script index parameter was being set too
aggressively meaning if the SDK didn't actually have an index to
provide then the index would be reset on the next frame to MaxValue
causing OculusSDK to not work.

The solution is to just remove the use of the `currentIndex` private
variable and just update and use the `index` public variable as this
will ensure there is only 1 true index variable being used and it is
updated at the correct time.

author: Christopher - Marcel Bddecker
message:
fix(OculusAvatar): only set up once

The Oculus Avatar SDK is supported by making sure the `OvrAvatar`
follows the movement of the play area game object. The script that
handles the following was added multiple times in some cases. This fix
makes sure to only add the script if needed.

author: Theston E. Fox
message:
fix(Interaction): remove register touch listeners from update

The Touch interaction listeners were being registered continually in
the Interact Grab and Interact Use Update method which eventually
would cause a stack overflow error.

This has now been resolved by removing the touch registration from
the Update method.

author: Christopher - Marcel Bddecker
message:
fix(UpdatePrompt): allow to move VRTK installation

The update prompt was looking for the version file in a fixed location.
This fix makes sure that it looks at the location relative to the
installation path of VRTK.

author: Christopher - Marcel Bddecker
message:
feat(SDKManager): clear scripting define symbols

Whenever one added a vendor SDK to the project the SDK Manager added the
associated scripting define symbols for it. But when one removes the
vendor SDK the symbols can't be removed automatically as there will be
compiler errors after removing the files.

A new button has been added to the SDK Manager editor to clear the used
symbols. This button works even if the project currently has compiler
errors.

author: Christopher - Marcel Bddecker
message:
fix(SDKManager): duplicated errors on SDK changes undo

Whenever the selected SDKs were changed in the SDK Manager via an undo,
the old SDKs were called before switching to the new ones. This fix
removes the calls to the old SDKs so only the new SDKs are used.

author: Theston E. Fox
message:
fix(Examples): remove auto populate from custom controller model scene

The SDK Manager now forces the controller alias models to be that of
the selected SDK if the `Auto Populate Object References` is checked.

This meant that the custom model controllers would not be affected
by the controller actions script.

The fix is to manually populate the object references.

author: Theston E. Fox
message:
fix(Interaction): force secondary controller release on primary drop

There was an issue where the secondary controller was not notified of
the object release if the secondary controller was grabbing whilst the
primary controller was released.

The action is that the object is dropped and the secondary controller
has no influence over the object any more, but the secondary
controller Interact Grab script was not notified of the drop so it
would not emit the event and would keep the state of a grabbed object
until the grab button on the secondary controller was released.

This has been fixed by calling `ForceRelease` on the secondary
controller if the primary controller is ungrabbed. As the secondary
controller grab actions are cleaned up before the primary controller
then a `ForceRelease` should simply clean up the state of the
secondary controller Interact Grab script and not actually force
drop the object if it's still being held by the primary controller.

author: Theston E. Fox
message:
chore(Examples): ensure all example scenes are in build list

A couple of the example scenes were renamed and therefore were no
longer included in the build list. This has been fixed.

author: Theston E. Fox
message:
chore(ControllerActions): remove deprecated script from example scene

The Controller Actions script was still being used in the
Interacting With Unity UI example scene. It has now been deprecated
and is no longer required.

author: Christopher - Marcel Bddecker
message:
refactor(UnityEvents): simplify by using new abstract superclass

A new abstract superclass `VRTK_UnityEvents` has been added to simplify
and standardize the various existing UnityEvents scripts. Additionally
all the xml docs have been removed from the UnityEvents scripts because
they add nothing to the documentation (the documentation already refers
to have a look at the respective scripts' documentation to learn more
about the events).
files_changed: VRTK_BasicTeleport_UnityEvents.cs; VRTK_BodyPhysics_UnityEvents.cs; VRTK_Button_UnityEvents.cs; VRTK_Control_UnityEvents.cs; VRTK_ControllerActions_UnityEvents.cs; VRTK_ControllerEvents_UnityEvents.cs; VRTK_DashTeleport_UnityEvents.cs; VRTK_DestinationMarker_UnityEvents.cs; VRTK_HeadsetCollision_UnityEvents.cs; VRTK_HeadsetControllerAware_UnityEvents.cs; VRTK_HeadsetFade_UnityEvents.cs; VRTK_InteractGrab_UnityEvents.cs; VRTK_InteractTouch_UnityEvents.cs; VRTK_InteractUse_UnityEvents.cs; VRTK_InteractableObject_UnityEvents.cs; VRTK_ObjectControl_UnityEvents.cs; VRTK_PlayerClimb_UnityEvents.cs; VRTK_SnapDropZone_UnityEvents.cs; VRTK_UIPointer_UnityEvents.cs; VRTK_UnityEvents.cs; VRTK_UnityEvents.cs.meta

author: Christopher - Marcel Bddecker
message:
refactor(Simulator): remove duplicated code

The Simulator Headset SDK does the same for both the headset getter
methods. This change removes one of the implementations and calls the
other one instead to remove the duplicated code.

author: Christopher - Marcel Bddecker
message:
refactor(Simulator): remove unnecessary private helper class

The Simulator Controller SDK used a private helper class for keeping
track of the controller objects. This change removes that class and
instead keeps track of the controller objects directly in the Controller
SDK.

author: Christopher - Marcel Bddecker
message:
chore(SDK): move private variable

A private variable in the Scripting Define Symbol Predicate Attribute
has been moved down to adhere to the coding conventions. Additionally an
exception message has been updated to keep the same style that is used
for the other error cases.

author: Theston E. Fox
message:
feat(Interaction): deprecate menu toggle button alias

The Controller Events script now has all button alias variables
deprecated as they are now all moved to the relevant scripts.

author: Christopher - Marcel Bddecker
message:
fix(Logger): saved to scene in Editor

If the Logger was used in the Editor to log something it was added to
scene. This fix makes sure the Logger isn't visible in and is not saved
to the scene when in the Editor.
Additionally the `DontDestroyOnLoad` call has been moved to not be
called when destroying the object anyway.

author: Theston E. Fox
message:
fix(Interaction): remove rigidbody requirement from snap drop zones

The Snap Drop Zones don't need a rigidbody on them for them to work
so there is no need to require the Rigidbody component. If one is
required by the developer then they can add one manually.

author: Christopher - Marcel Bddecker
message:
refactor(Logger): use params array

The Logger's `GetCommonMessage` method was updated to allow specifying
the `parameters` argument via comma separation instead of creating a new
array. All usages of the method have been simplified.
files_changed: Follow.cs; PanelMenuUIGrid.cs; PanelMenuUISlider.cs; Sphere_Spawner.cs; VRTK_ControllerAppearance_Example.cs; VRTK_ControllerEvents_ListenerExample.cs; VRTK_ControllerInteract_ListenerExample.cs; VRTK_ControllerPointerEvents_ListenerExample.cs; VRTK_ControllerUIPointerEvents_ListenerExample.cs; VRTK_RoomExtender_ControllerExample.cs; VRTK_SnapDropZone.cs; SDK_InputSimulator.cs; PanelMenuController.cs; VRTK_IndependentRadialMenuController.cs; RadialMenuController.cs; VRTK_CustomJointGrabAttach.cs; VRTK_OutlineObjectCopyHighlighter.cs; VRTK_ControllerHighlighter.cs; VRTK_InteractControllerAppearance.cs; VRTK_InteractGrab.cs; VRTK_InteractHaptics.cs; VRTK_InteractTouch.cs; VRTK_InteractUse.cs; VRTK_ObjectAutoGrab.cs; VRTK_Logger.cs; VRTK_RoomExtender_PlayAreaGizmo.cs; VRTK_BaseObjectControlAction.cs; VRTK_MoveInPlace.cs; VRTK_ObjectControl.cs; VRTK_RoomExtender.cs; VRTK_TouchpadMovement.cs; VRTK_TouchpadWalking.cs; VRTK_BasePointer.cs; VRTK_PlayAreaCursor.cs; VRTK_Pointer.cs; VRTK_BodyPhysics.cs; VRTK_HeadsetFade.cs; VRTK_PositionRewind.cs; VRTK_UICanvas.cs; VRTK_UIDraggableItem.cs; VRTK_UIPointer.cs; VRTK_Simulator.cs

author: Christopher - Marcel Bddecker
message:
refactor(Logger): use trace log level by default

When adding the Logger script to the scene to customize its settings the
log level was initially set to `Info` by default, despite the
automatically created Logger using `Trace` instead.
This change makes sure `Trace` is used in all cases by default and
simplifies the automatic creation to use the default values.

author: Theston E. Fox
message:
chore(Utilities): clean up comment in Transform Follow

The Transform Follow script had a comment that had two sets of slashes
which was incorrect.

author: Theston E. Fox
message:
fix(Locomotion): remove teleport exclusions from example scene

The Touchpad Walking example scene had teleport exclusions set up
on the steps which meant that the new body physics step detection
was not moving up the stairs as they were being ignored from the
teleporter.

author: Theston E. Fox
message:
fix(Presence): ensure is moving isn't always toggled on in body phsyics

The Body Physics script was continually toggling the isMoving parameter
even when standing still due to the ray cast collection that checks to
see if the user is walking over an uneven floor.

This was because the system casts 2 rays down, 1 from the headset
position and 1 just outside of the body collider and checks to see if
the difference means an incline/decline has occured. The issue was
that the headset rotation was affecting the forward direction of the
second down cast.

Another additional parameter has been added to allow the play area
movement threshold to be determined to prevent the headset pushing
the play area back if the headset is moved very slowly.

The code has also been cleaned up to make it easier to read.

author: Christopher - Marcel Bddecker
message:
chore(gitattributes): allow asset diffs

The `.gitattributes` file was set up to treat various Unity assets as
binary files but they are in fact text files. To allow diff'ing the
files git needs to treat these files as text files. Since treating files
as text files is the default this change removes the `.gitattributes`
file completely, as it doesn't do anything else.

author: Theston E. Fox
message:
refactor(Structure): update Unity deprecated methods to omit messages

Refactor code that has been deprecated so Unity no longer prints
deprecation methods for any Unity code that has been deprecated.
files_changed: Arrow.cs; ArrowNotch.cs; Breakable_Cube.cs; UI_Interactions.cs; VRTK_ChildOfControllerGrabAttach.cs; VRTK_PlayAreaCursor.cs; VRTK_AdaptiveQuality.cs

author: Theston E. Fox
message:
chore(Structure): remove calls to deprecated AliasMenuOn/Off events

The AliasMenuOn/Off events have been deprecated along with all of the
other Controller Events script alias events.

It has been replaced with the ButtonTwoPressed/Release events.

author: Theston E. Fox
message:
chore(AdaptiveQuality): extract deprecated method and provide wrapper

The VRStats.gpuTimeLastFrame has been deprecated in Unity 5.6 so the
call to this method in the Adaptive Quality script has now been changed
to call a wrapper method in Shared Methods and this new method wraps
the behaviour so the deprecated version of the method is only called in
the older versions of Unity before 5.6.

author: Theston E. Fox
message:
fix(SDK): ensure SteamVR works by default in Unity 5.6

There is an issue with SteamVR 1.2.1 and below and Unity 5.6
where the VR camera does not have the SteamVR_UpdatePoses script on
it and therefore the controllers do not appear.

This check simply adds the required script if it is missing. This fix
will probably be removed in the future when SteamVR is fixed.

author: Theston E. Fox
message:
fix(SnapDropZone): clean up on destroy of snapped object

If a snapped object was destroyed (using `Destroy`) then the snap
drop zone would not have it's state reset and the zone would no
longer be usable as it was still in a snapped state.

This fix checks to see if the snapped object is still valid and if
not then it emits the unsnap event.

author: Theston E. Fox
message:
feat(Locomotion): allow move in place to not require button press

The Move In Place script can now have the engage button set to
`Undefined` and it will not require a button press to allow the
controller swing to move the play area.

author: Theston E. Fox
message:
feat(Locomotion): add specific controller direction for move in place

The Move In Place script can now use specific controllers to control
the direction that the play area will move when arm swinging.

The existing controller rotation will stil require both controllers
or can be either the left or right depending on the controller
settings.

There are also 3 new options:

 * EngageControllerRotationOnly: uses the controller that the engage
 button is pressed on for the direction.
 * LeftControllerRotationOnly: uses only the left controller for
 direction.
 * RightControllerRotationOnly: uses only the right controller for
 direction.

author: Theston E. Fox
message:
fix(SnapDropZone): prevent enter zone event firing multiple times

The `OnObjectEnteredSnapDropZone` event would fire multiple times when
an object was held over a drop zone collider.

This has been fixed now by doing a simple check if the same object is
being held in the drop zone and only fire the event on the first
occurance.

It will also fire the enter event when the object is removed from the
drop zone as it has been unsnapped and is in the drop zone collider
space again.

author: Harvey Ball
message:
chore(Prefabs): move panel menu and radial menu to prefabs directory

  > **Breaking Changes**

The Panel Menu and Radial Menu scripts were both within
`Scripts/Controls/2D` however both of these elements are prefabs and
therefore the scripts for the associated prefabs should sit within the
prefabs directory.

Also, the script names have been updated to include the `VRTK_` prefix
that all other scripts have to allow easy identification of a VRTK
script.

There are now no files in the Controls/2D directory so it has been
removed.

As the files have been renamed, this may cause issues if they are being
added via script, however any editor added script should automatically
update as the previous .meta files are still valid.
files_changed: VRTK_RadialMenuEditor.cs; VRTK_RadialMenuEditor.cs.meta; PanelMenuUIGrid.cs; PanelMenuUISlider.cs; VRTK_IndependentRadialMenuController.cs; VRTK_IndependentRadialMenuController.cs.meta; VRTK_PanelMenuController.cs; VRTK_PanelMenuController.cs.meta; VRTK_PanelMenuItemController.cs; VRTK_PanelMenuItemController.cs.meta; VRTK_RadialMenu.cs; VRTK_RadialMenu.cs.meta; VRTK_RadialMenuController.cs; VRTK_RadialMenuController.cs.meta; SubPrefabs.meta; RadialMenuButton.meta; Arc.prefab; Arc.prefab.meta; RadialButtonIcon.cs; RadialButtonIcon.cs.meta; UICircle.cs; UICircle.cs.meta; PanelMenu.meta; RadialMenu.meta; Editor.meta; DOCUMENTATION.md

author: Harvey Ball
message:
fix(Interaction): ensure to wake rigidbody when removed from drop zone

If an Interactable Object was removed from a drop zone using
ForceUnsnap then it would not wake the rigidbody up and it would just
hang in the air.

This fix forces the rigidbody to wake up and therefore physics will
continue to be applied after a force unsnap.

author: Harvey Ball
message:
chore(Structure): suppress internal obsolete warnings

As a number of core VRTK scripts and methods have been deprecated, it
meant that existing VRTK scripts that still relied on those elements
were using deprecated items.

Usually, when something is deprecated it is replaced with a new item
that can be used in place of the old, however, with some of the
elements that have been deprecated in VRTK, this was not possible.

For example, the `Layers To Ignore` parameter has been replaced with
a more complex Custom Raycast script so a direct replacement is not
possible as it is a paradigm change in how things work. The original
`Layers To Ignore` cannot simply be removed from the internal scripts
as this would break existing behaviour (and therefore not be a valid
deprecation).

This meant that deprecation warning messages were being output to
the console and as there were many of these internal deprecation
cases, the console was being filled with warning messages, which
was annoying and unsightly.

The fix is to wrap any internal use of an obsolete item in the
`#pragma warning disable 0618` tag to ensure any internal deprecation
messages are suppressed.

When the deprecated items are finally removed, these additional
tags will also be removed as the offending lines will no longer raise
any deprecation warning methods.
files_changed: VRTK_Button.cs; VRTK_Control.cs; VRTK_ControllerEvents.cs; VRTK_HeightAdjustTeleport.cs; VRTK_TouchpadMovement.cs; VRTK_BezierPointerRenderer.cs; VRTK_StraightPointerRenderer.cs; VRTK_BodyPhysics.cs; VRTK_ControllerActions_UnityEvents.cs; VRTK_ControllerEvents_UnityEvents.cs

author: Harvey Ball
message:
refactor(Structure): move obsolete suppression pragma statements

The pragma statements that are being used to suppress the internal
obsolete messages have been moved so they wrap the entire deprecated
section rather than just a specific line, this is cleaner and it means
the document generator no longer breaks.

author: Harvey Ball
message:
feat(ControllerReference): add new way of referencing controllers

Previously, controller calls were referenced in a number of ways from
utilising the controller's id, to passing a game object of either the
actual controller game object or the script alias game object.

This meant that ways to call certain methods was fragmented and lead
to confusing different options between methods.

The new ControllerReference script is used to get a reference to
a controller based on any number of things such as an index, the
actual GameObject, the script alias Object, the model Object or
even the controller hand.

Once a reference is retrieved, it can then access all of the elements
of a controller, such as:

 * index
 * actual
 * scriptAlias
 * model
 * hand

The ControllerReference script also has a collection of static methods
that are preferably used rather than needing to instantiate a new
object as the static methods do some nice checking to make sure
the ControllerReference is valid.

The Controller References are also cached for performance and
different instances of a Controller Reference object can be compared
as a custom comparator has been provided that compares on the index
of the controller which would always be universally unique.

A large collection of methods in the SDK implementations and SDK Bridge
have been re-written to utilise the Controller Reference, whilst a
collection of methods in the SDK Bridge have been deprecated and the
relevant methods in the SDK implementations have been removed.

All of the event payloads that passed a controller index around now
pass a controller reference, with the index being deprecated.

Added a basic test script to the Examples directory to test the
functionality of the Controller Reference script to ensure it is
all working as expected.

author: Harvey Ball
message:
fix(Interaction): recognize touchpad axis movement on oculus touch

The Controller Events script was not recognizing the thumbstick axis
changes on the Oculus Touch controllers unless the touch sensitive
pad at the top of the thumbstick was being touched.

This is because the Controller Events script would force set the
touchpad axis to not being moved if no touch of the button was
found.

This works fine on the Vive wand and is wanted as the vive wand
touchpad axis can wander and report changes in axis when it's
not being touched. But for the Oculus Touch, this additional check
is counter productive.

To fix the issue, the check to see if the touchpad is static or not
has been abstracted into the Controller SDK so each SDK can handle
how they want to determine if the touchpad axis is static or not.

The private method used for comparing the touchpad axis values has now
also been moved to the Shared Methods script as it is a useful generic
method that is now also used by the Controller SDK.

author: Harvey Ball
message:
refactor(Interaction): reduce code lines in track object grab

The Track Object grab mechanic has been refactored slightly so the
lines used to get the position and rotation delta are no longer
long handed `if` statements and are now just shortened to two lines.

author: Harvey Ball
message:
fix(SDK): remove erroneous parameter from boundary methods

A few of the SDK Boundary methods required a playArea GameObject to
be passed into them, however many of the internal methods didn't
use this GameObject as they can access the cached version of the
play area or simply make the same `GetPlayArea()` call which was
being used to pass the playArea object into the method in the first
place.
files_changed: SDK_BaseBoundaries.cs; SDK_DaydreamBoundaries.cs; SDK_FallbackBoundaries.cs; SDK_OculusBoundaries.cs; SDK_SimBoundaries.cs; SDK_SteamVRBoundaries.cs; VRTK_SDK_Bridge.cs; SDK_XimmerseBoundaries.cs; VRTK_RoomExtender_PlayAreaGizmo.cs; VRTK_PlayAreaCursor.cs; DOCUMENTATION.md

author: Harvey Ball
message:
feat(Interaction): move methods from SharedMethods to specific scripts

The SharedMethods script had a collection of static calls to things
like controller haptics and to object appearances, which relied upon
Instance Method scripts being spun up in the background.

This is a long winded approach and has been replaced now by a specific
script to deal with the static haptic methods and a specific script
to deal with the static object appearance methods.

The respective new scripts will also spin up an instance behind the
scenes to handle any required coroutines rather than having some
overall script manage these instances.

Once the script instance is created, it doesn't need to be created
again.

author: Christopher - Marcel Bddecker
message:
refactor(SDKManager): move build target group getter

The `GetValidBuildTargetGroups` method was actually used in multiple
places. This change moves the method into SharedMethods and updates
any duplicated usage of the original code to call that new method
instead.

author: Christopher - Marcel Bddecker
message:
feat(SupportInfo): add window to list and copy info for support

To simplify answering support questions about VRTK a new helper
editor window has been added. It lists version info and scripting
define symbols used. The info is listed and a button allows to copy
it to the clipboard.

author: Harvey Ball
message:
refactor(DestinationPoint): provide verbose equality check on null

The equality checks have been updated so they specifically check
against null.

`if(this)` is replaced with the explicit `if(this != null)`

`if(!this)` is replaced with the explicit `if(this == null)`

author: Harvey Ball
message:
feat(Pointer): add ability to hide play area cursor on invalid location

A new option has been added to the Play Area Cursor script that will
hide the play area cursor if the cursor location is invalid (e.g. it
does not match the policy list or a play area collision has occurred).

This is useful for only showing the play area cursor when the user
is able to move to the new destination.

author: Harvey Ball
message:
fix(Locomotion): move in place left controller only check

The Move In Place script was not doing the Left Controller Only check
correctly as it was checking to see if the right controller was not
null where as it should have been checking to see if the left
controller was not null. This has now been fixed.

author: Harvey Ball
message:
feat(Presence): provide collision sweep detection for body physics

The Body Physics script now has a new method `SweepCollision` that
can be used to determine if the body physics body collider will
collide with an object if it continues to move in a given direction
for a given distance.

This new method is now used in some of the Locomotion methods that
move the play area via `transform.position` and can now check
if they are provided with a Body Physics script if when they move
forward, will the new position cause collision tunnelling and if
it does then the movement can be denied meaning tunnelling is not
possible.
files_changed: VRTK_BaseObjectControlAction.cs; VRTK_SlideObjectControlAction.cs; VRTK_SnapRotateObjectControlAction.cs; VRTK_WarpObjectControlAction.cs; VRTK_MoveInPlace.cs; VRTK_BodyPhysics.cs; VRTK_CustomRaycast.cs; DOCUMENTATION.md

author: Harvey Ball
message:
fix(Presence): remove console warning in position rewind

The PositionRewind script was throwing a console warning because
the script was trying to do a Vector3 to null comparison which
will never be able to succeed.

author: Harvey Ball
message:
feat(Pointer): move direction indicator into base renderer

The Pointer Direction Indicator parameter is now on the Pointer
Renderer rather than the top level pointer. This means that different
renderers can contain different pointer supplements and be swapped
out at runtime.

author: Christopher-Marcel Bddecker
message:
feat(UpdatePrompt): manual update checking and improvements

Users can now search for updates manually in case they don't want to
wait for the next update check to run or when they disabled
notifications for a version. Checking for updates manually can now
be done via the menu item at `Window > VRTK > Check for Updates`.

Additionally the Update Prompt now:
- shows as soon as it's checking for updates
- shows if there was an error fetching the current version
- shows the release name in case there is a special one set on
GitHub
- is using the version defined by `VRTK_Defines` (`version.txt` is
removed)
- remembers the disabled notification state for a given version
properly
- allows checking for updates again via a button in the window
- allows downloading the update from the Asset Store and GitHub
- opens the Asset Store instead of the browser
- removes old notification ignoring data from the EditorPrefs

author: Harvey Ball
message:
feat(Utilities): simplify headset checking in device finder

The `GetHeadsetType` method in the DeviceFinder script has now been
simplified to parse the current headset string and process it by
removing any spaces and full stops `.` so a pure string can be
compared.

This processing of the VR device string is then cached so further
processing is not required.

A new method has been added that resets the headset cache if for
some reason the headset type changes at runtime then the cache can
be reset so it is re-parsed and re-processed.

author: Harvey Ball
message:
feat(Locomotion): rename force teleport to teleport and add new method

The `ForceTeleport` method has now been renamed to `Teleport` and a
new `ForceTeleport` method has been added that simply takes a
position and a rotation and sets the player location to those given
parameters.

author: Harvey Ball
message:
feat(Structure): remove deprecated classes and methods

All classes and methods that have been marked as deprecated/obsolete
have now been removed.

author: Christopher-Marcel Bddecker
message:
feat(DesktopCamera): render desktop-only camera while in VR

There's a need to show something different on the desktop window
than what's shown in the VR headset. The potential use cases range
from offering nicer spectator views to showing completely different
views for asymmetrical games.
In combination with VRTK's existing ObjectFollow scripts this allows
for trailer recordings in which the VR headset's movement is
smoothed.

Having a separated desktop-only camera allows for:
- additional overlays or effects
- render other layers in addition/only
- changing the FOV
- ...

This change adds the new `VRTK_DesktopCamera` script and a
corresponding prefab that shows how to use the optional support for
rendering the headset's view in addition to the desktop-only view.

author: Christopher-Marcel Bddecker
message:
fix(SDKManager): handle null Behaviour

The SDK Manager offers to remember any Behaviour to automatically
toggle it off and on based on whether an SDK Setup is loaded to
remove the need to listen to the SDK Setup Loaded event manually.
When users forget to call the remove method the SDK Manager will
throw a null reference exception which doesn't offer the user enough
info.

This fix handles that case and logs an error in addition to removing
the bad Behaviours.

author: Christopher-Marcel Bddecker
message:
fix(SDKManager): deprecate persist on load setting

When using the persist on load setting on the SDK Manager it is
moved to the `DontDestroyOnLoad` scene at runtime by Unity. That
scene is inaccessible which means there's no way to find objects in
that scene. Because of the issues related to looking up objects in
the inaccessible scene the persist on load setting on the SDK
Manager is now deprecated.

It's recommended to use additive scene loading instead. To reduce
the likelihood of these issues breaking the project for users
already using the setting this fix also makes sure to only populate
the SDK Setup object references when this setting is *not* checked.

author: Harvey Ball
message:
chore(Pointer): add system library to allow obsolete tag

A previous merge removed the System library but than a subsequent
merge required it for the `Obsolete` tag.

These cross merges meant there was an error left in the script.

author: Christopher-Marcel Bddecker
message:
fix(SDK): ensure simulator position is correct

  > **Breaking Changes**

The example scenes were using a script to position the simulator rig
correctly. This is no longer needed after recent changes to the
simulator and therefore the script and its usage in the `SDKSetups`
prefab is removed.

If users of VRTK used this script previously or broke the prefab
link to the `SDKSetups` prefab they need to remove any usage of the
script.

author: Harvey Ball
message:
refactor(Interaction): apply best practice coding standards

The cases where an interactable object checks for a null value have
been updated to ensure they do an explicit check. Also the foreach
loops have been replaced with for loops as they are more efficient
in Unity 5.5 and below.

The Object Auto Grab script also now correctly cancels the
coroutine if the script is disabled.

author: Christopher-Marcel Bddecker
message:
fix(Examples): remove unused variable to resolve warning

There was an unused variable introduced in the previous capsense
axis commit. The fix is to remove said variable.

author: Christopher-Marcel Bddecker
message:
fix(RadialMenu): disable mouse interactions

The radial menu prefab was using a `GraphicRaycaster` which meant that
the canvas used for the menu was responding to the mouse. The fix is to
either add a `VRTK_UICanvas` to the prefab in case one wants to interact
with the menu via the VRTK pointers or to remove the raycaster. This fix
chooses the latter as users of VRTK probably only want to enable usage
of the radial menu by touchpad only.

author: Christopher-Marcel Bddecker
message:
fix(RadialMenu): remove unused image

The radial menu prefab had an unused image in it which has been
removed.

author: Christopher-Marcel Bddecker
message:
fix(RadialMenu): buttons have colored background

The radial menu buttons all had a colored background added to them
which is white by default. The issue was that a previous commit
removed the needed `OnPopulateMesh` method because that one was
using a deprecated argument instead of the one it was replaced with.
Instead of removing said method this fix makes sure to change the
method to take the new argument.

author: Harvey Ball
message:
refactor(Controls): reduce size of button methods

The Button script methods have been reduced in size by
breaking large methods up into smaller methods to make the
code easier to read.

author: Harvey Ball
message:
fix(Controls): prevent button anchor changing on enable

The button anchor was continually changing based on the initial
constant force that had been added to the button which meant
every time a button was disabled and re-enabled the position of
the button would move slightly each time.

This fix allows the anchor to be auto configured the first time
but then after that it prevents it from be auto set so it stays
at the correct position.

author: Christopher-Marcel Bddecker
message:
feat(SDKManager): simplify single SDK Setup configurations

Supporting multiple SDKs means VRTK had to disable all the SDK
Setups that are used automatically to ensure they're usable for
runtime switching. This change allows to completely bypass the
runtime loading and that requirement in case only one SDK Setup is
used. This means users of VRTK don't have to bother with handling
when an SDK Setup is loaded and usable, nor do they have to
re-enable their SDK Setups game objects again to work on them in the
editor while they're visible.

The SteamVR SDK Setup in the SDKSetups prefab is changed to allow
for this new behavior. This also fixes a bug that resulted in
invalid matrix errors being logged to the console by Unity.

author: Harvey Ball
message:
feat(Avatar): add basic avatar hand prefab with controller script

A new set of avatar hand models has been added with a controller script
for animating movement of the fingers on the hand models.

It's also possible to provide custom finger axis values based on the
current interaction type (e.g. touch, grab, use).

The CustomControllerModel example scene has been updated to use the new
avatar hands as an example of how to use them.

Big thanks to @jimthegrim in the VRTK slack channel for all of the
hard work on the hand models, animations and figuring out the
layers and weights work in Unity to make these hands possible. <3

author: Harvey Ball
message:
fix(Locomotion): correctly check controller state in move in place

The MoveInPlace script was passing the wrong parameter to the
`CheckControllerState` method and it was checking the left subscribed
button for the right controller state. This fix ensures it is checking

author: Harvey Ball
message:
refactor(ControllerTooltips): initialise arrays in declaration

To prevent any unwanted null reference exceptions, the arrays in
the controller tooltips have been initialised to a default size
so if they're called before the init code is run then they at
least will be valid empty arrays.

author: Harvey Ball
message:
refactor(SnapDropZone): reduce GetComponent calls in update

The SnapDropZone script would continually call `GetComponent` in the
`Update` method as well as in the `OnTriggerStay` method to attempt
to get the Interactable Object component of the snappable GameObject.

This was an inefficient call and has been replaced with a cached
version of the interactable object to ensure the inefficient
`GetComponent` call is removed from the `Update` and `OnTriggerStay`
methods.

author: Harvey Ball
message:
feat(Interaction): emit event when controller model is available

The Controller Model is now emitted via a new event on the
TrackedController script (which is also re-thrown by the
ControllerEvents script). This event is emitted when the model
of the connected controller is loaded in.

Previously, a number of scripts would duplicate the same coroutine
for determining when the controller model was available. This new
event removes the need for this duplication as these scripts can just
listen for this event.

The `GetCurrentControllerType` method now accepts a ControllerReference
to determine specific connected controller type. If `null` is passed
then it will attempt to get the right controller first then the left
if the right is not available.
files_changed: VRTK_AvatarHandController.cs; VRTK_ControllerTooltips.cs; SDK_BaseController.cs; SDK_DaydreamController.cs; SDK_FallbackController.cs; SDK_OculusController.cs; SDK_SimController.cs; SDK_SteamVRController.cs; VRTK_SDK_Bridge.cs; SDK_XimmerseController.cs; VRTK_ControllerEvents.cs; VRTK_ControllerHighlighter.cs; VRTK_InteractGrab.cs; VRTK_InteractTouch.cs; VRTK_TrackedController.cs; VRTK_ControllerEvents_UnityEvents.cs; VRTK_DeviceFinder.cs; VRTK_SDKTransformModify.cs; DOCUMENTATION.md

author: Harvey Ball
message:
feat(Simulator): deprecate VRTK Simulator

The VRTK Simulator has been superseded by the VRTK SDK Simulator which
simulates the entire SDK setup rather than just enabling the camera rig
to move around with key presses.

This means there is little reason to keep this old simulator.

author: Harvey Ball
message:
refactor(Structure): apply coding conventions

Update some scripts that were not adhering to the coding conventions
such as using the `var` keyword or using `private` variables and
methods.

author: Harvey Ball
message:
refactor(Structure): replace occurrences of Equals with ==

Unity3d creates garbage when dealing with `Equals` as it's considered
a Boxing method and therefore is less efficient than simply comparing
with `==`

This information can be found at: goo.gl/apMyGU

This refactor replaces all of the occurrences of `Equals` with `==`
to provide the efficiency improvements.

The MoveInPlace script has also been slightly refactored to use a
`switch` statement rather than a collection of `if/else` statements
that all in turn used the `Equals` method as well.
files_changed: BowAim.cs; VRTK_DestinationPoint.cs; SDK_BaseController.cs; VRTK_Slider.cs; VRTK_InteractGrab.cs; VRTK_InteractUse.cs; VRTK_ControllerReference.cs; VRTK_VRInputModule.cs; VRTK_MoveInPlace.cs; VRTK_BodyPhysics.cs

author: Harvey Ball
message:
chore(SDK): rename VR Simulator prefab and move to CameraRigs directory

The VR Simulator camera rig prefab has been renamed to be more inline
with the Unity camera rig. Both of these camera rigs have been moved
to a new `Prefabs/CameraRigs/` directory to keep things neater.

author: Harvey Ball
message:
refactor(SDK): replace oculus angular velocity calculations

The Oculus SDK now uses the Velocity Estimator to calculate the
angular velocity of the controllers and the headset.

Even though the Oculus SDK has a `GetLocalControllerAngularVelocity`
method on `OVRInput` this seems to provide the rotations in an
incorrect direction, plus the documentation still says this is
supposed to return a Quaternion rather than a Vector3 (and it actually
returns a Vector3). Because of these omissions, it's not trustworthy
enough to use the build in Oculus SDK angular velocity method at
this time.

author: Harvey Ball
message:
fix(Interaction): remove valid controller check from secondary action

The Secondary Grab Action was checking to see if the controller was a
valid grab controller on the interactable object.

This did not make sense as if the right controller was a valid grab
controller then only the right controller could pick up the object
but then the left controller could never initiate a secondary grab
action as the right controller was the only one denoted as being
valid to initiate a grab action.

author: Harvey Ball
message:
refactor(Structure): apply coding conventions to codebase

A number of files were not adhering to the coding conventions and
using the `var` keyword or using `foreach` instead of `for`.

Also some coroutines were not being started and stopped correctly
without necessary checking before stopping.

author: Harvey Ball

refactor(Structure): apply coding conventions to scripts

The coding conventions about not using `var` and preferring `for`
over `foreach` has been applied to more code.

author: Harvey Ball
message:
refactor(Structure): change documentation style for enums

The enum documentation has now been changed to the correct way of
documenting enum values for C# by using the `<summary>` tag above
each of the enum values.

Additional unsupported tags have been removed (for now) from the code
docs so the documentation generates correctly.

It would be appropriate to add this sort of inline tagging only when
the doc generator supports it and it is used universally throughout
all of the classes.

author: Harvey Ball
message:
chore(Structure): reorganise location of documentation

The documentation has been restructured so it is in a specific
directory and the SDK documentation is within the SDK directories
to keep the repository cleaner and make it easier for expanding
documentation in the future.
