author: Harvey Ball
message:
feat(SnapDropZone): use interaction events for snapping

The SnapDropZone has been refactored to now utilise the
interactable object over a simple GameObject. This also
enables the ability to listen for the ungrab event on the
interactable object and then determine the snap on that event
rather than constantly polling in the OnTriggerStay method for
the snap event.

This also means that the default snapped object has been deprecated
and an interactable object is provided as the default.

Only interactable objects can be snapped so this makes more sense.

author: Harvey Ball
message:
chore(Structure): support new XR naming convention in 2017.2

Unity 2017.2 has changed all of the VR packages and VR class names
and renamed them to XR. To ensure future proofing, all of the
references to VR classes have been updated XR and then script
define symbols for any Unity version older than 2017.2 create
class aliases from the old VR convention to the new XR convention.

The VRSettings.renderScale method has been completely renamed so
it's not possible to alias it. In this case a new helper method
has been created in SharedMethods that allows the retrieval of
the renderScale and another method which sets it.
files_changed: API.md; VRTK_SDKSetupEditor.cs; SDK_UnityCameraRig.cs; SDK_UnityControllerTracker.cs; VRTK_SDKManager.cs; VRTK_AdaptiveQuality.cs; VRTK_DeviceFinder.cs; VRTK_SharedMethods.cs

author: Harvey Ball
message:
feat(SDK): ability to synchronise the play area transform on sdk switch

A new checkbox on the SDK Setup Switcher that when checked will
synchronise the play area transform to the previous play area transform
when the SDK is switched.

This is useful when wanting to move the play area around with the
Simulator and then switch to an SDK of an actual HMD and be in the
position of where the Simulator was moved to.

author: Harvey Ball
message:
feat(Interaction): extract interactable object highlight to new script

The Interactable Object script has now had the `Touch Highlight`
parameter deprecated and a new script called Interact Object
Highlighter that deals with highlighting the Interactable Object based
on any of the interaction types.

This allows for highlighting on near touch, touch, grab and use without
any of that logic needing to sit within the Interactable Object. The
ties to the Interactable Object highlighter in other scripts like
Interact Touch and Interact Grab have also been removed as they are
no longer required to manage the highlighter as the new script uses
the Interactable Object interaction events to determine when to
manage the highlighter.

The InteractableObject `ToggleHighlight` method has also been
deprecated in favour of two new methods `Highlight` and `Unhighlight`
that make it explicitly clear of how to use the methods.

The Object Setup editor script has also been tidied up and now
generates the required Interac Object Highlight script if required.
files_changed: API.md; VRTK_ObjectSetup.cs; VRTK_InteractGrab.cs; VRTK_InteractObjectHighlighter.cs; VRTK_InteractObjectHighlighter.cs.meta; VRTK_InteractTouch.cs; VRTK_InteractableObject.cs; VRTK_InteractObjectHighlighter_UnityEvents.cs; VRTK_InteractObjectHighlighter_UnityEvents.cs.meta

author: Harvey Ball
message:
feat(Interaction): add near touch to interact haptics

The Interact Haptics script now has an option for initiating haptics
on a near touch interaction event.

The Interact Haptics script has also been refactored to use the
Interactable Object events rather than having hard coded method calls
from the interaction scripts (Touch/Grab/Use) to the Interact Haptics
script.

The Interactable Object script has a new method to help subscribe
and unsubscribe from these interaction events and the Interact
Object Highlighter has also been refactored to use these new event
subscription helpers.
files_changed: API.md; VRTK_InteractHapticsEditor.cs; VRTK_InteractGrab.cs; VRTK_InteractHaptics.cs; VRTK_InteractObjectHighlighter.cs; VRTK_InteractTouch.cs; VRTK_InteractUse.cs; VRTK_InteractableObject.cs; VRTK_InteractHaptics_UnityEvents.cs

author: Harvey Ball
message:
refactor(Structure): remove code that is no longer required

There were a couple of warnings being thrown because code was not being
used anywhere.

author: Harvey Ball
message:
fix(Interaction): ensure valid grab attempt is called

The Interact Grab script requires the `IsValidGrabAttempt` method
to be called to set up state for future method calls.

This was removed during a cleanup that said the line was not being
used, but the variable it was being assigned to wasn't being used,
however, the method call was still required.

author: Harvey Ball
message:
fix(SnapDropZone): allow grab remove from unsnappable joints

A previous commit made it so it was not possible to unsnap objects
from Snap Drop Zones when they left the trigger collider if they were
considered objects that should not be able to be unsnapped.

However, this caused an issue that it was not possible to grab objects
out of snap drop zones either without releasing them and having them
snap straight back into the snap drop zone.

This issue ensures any grabbed object can be removed from a snap drop
zone.

author: Harvey Ball
message:
fix(SnapDropZone): remove shadows from highlight object

The highlight object on the Snap Drop Zone was casting a shadow and
was also set to receive shadows. This fix forces all mesh renderers
of the snap drop zone to not cast or receive shadows.

author: Victor Hagsand
message:
fix(SnapDropZone): prioritise joint removal on highlight object

If the interactable object that is being used as the highlight object
template has a joint on it, then it would cause issues due to the
rigidbody attempting to be removed first which would then fail because
a Joint was present. This would cause the snap drop zone highlight
object to keep it's rigidbody and fall will the physics gravity when
the scene started.

author: reznovVR
message:
fix(Simulator): ensure mouse lock behaviour works correctly

This fixes the simulator mouse cursor lock to behave as expected with
the "Always" selection of the "Mouse movement input" mode and actually
lock the cursor in the game view.

author: Harvey Ball
message:
feat(Interaction): move transform grab mechanic

The Move Transform grab mechanic allows an Interactable Object to be
moved around by simply updating the transform position in relation to
the position of the grabbing object attach point.

The position can also be limited across the x,y,z axes so it cannot
be moved around freely.

author: Harvey Ball
message:
feat(Interaction): rotate transform grab mechanic

The Rotate Transform Grab Mechanic allows an Interactable Object to be
rotated around a specified local transform axis between given angle
limits. It doesn't use any physics to rotate the object and simply
changes the local rotation based on the position of the controller in
relation to the circular motion around the object.

A couple of reusable methods have been extracted into the SharedMethods
script such as the NormalizeValue method which takes a given value and
the range and then normalizes the value between `0f` and `1f`. The
DividerToMultiplier method takes a value that is to be used as a
divider and converts it in to the value to use for the multiplication
operation which would result in the same answer. This is helpful as
it prevents division by zero errors.

The relevant scripts have been updated to utilise these new methods.
files_changed: API.md; VRTK_MoveTransformGrabAttach.cs; VRTK_RotateTransformGrabAttach.cs; VRTK_RotateTransformGrabAttach.cs.meta; VRTK_CurveGenerator.cs; VRTK_DashTeleport.cs; VRTK_RotateTransformGrabAttach_UnityEvents.cs; VRTK_RotateTransformGrabAttach_UnityEvents.cs.meta; VRTK_SharedMethods.cs

author: Harvey Ball
message:
feat(Locomotion): add tunnel overlay camera effect for comfort options

The Tunnel Overlay script creates a texture overlay that can increase
in it's radius towards the centre of the screen to reduce the perceived
field of view.

This can be triggered based on the movement and rotation of the play
area to reduce nausea with artificial locomotion. The tunnel effect
can also be applied when stationary to simulate effects such as damage
being taken.

Thanks to @reznovVR for the original port of the excellent
UnityVRTunnelling repo by @sixways:

https://github.com/SixWays/UnityVrTunnelling
files_changed: API.md; TunnelOverlay.mat; TunnelOverlay.mat.meta; VRTK_TunnelEffect.shader; VRTK_TunnelEffect.shader.meta; VRTK_TunnelEffect.cs; VRTK_TunnelEffect.cs.meta; VRTK_TunnelOverlay.cs; VRTK_TunnelOverlay.cs.meta

author: Harvey Ball
message:
feat(Interaction): allow different rotation actions for rotate grab

The Rotate Transform Grab Mechanic now has a new rotation action option
which allows the object to be rotated based on not only the angle in
difference between the origin of the object and the controller current
grab position but can also be based on the rotation of the controller
through one of it's axes (roll, pitch, yaw).

This can help with simulating other mechanics such as turning a screw
by swiveling the controller in the hand instead of grabbing and pulling
the object in the direction to move it.

author: Harvey Ball
message:
feat(Interaction): add physics pusher controllable

The Physics Pusher controllable creates a joint object that can have
physics force applied to move the controllable in a designated
direction to simulate a button.

The 3D Control button has now been deprecated in the first commit of
deprecating all of the existing 3D controls as they are being replaced
with the new Controllables controls.
files_changed: API.md; 025_Controls_Overview.unity; ButtonReactor.cs; ControlReactor.cs; VRTK_Button.cs; VRTK_Button.cs.meta; Controllables.meta; Physics.meta; VRTK_BasePhysicsControllable.cs; VRTK_BasePhysicsControllable.cs.meta; VRTK_PhysicsPusher.cs; VRTK_PhysicsPusher.cs.meta; VRTK_BaseControllable.cs; VRTK_BaseControllable.cs.meta; VRTK_IgnoreInteractTouchColliders.cs; VRTK_IgnoreInteractTouchColliders.cs.meta; VRTK_BaseControllable_UnityEvents.cs; VRTK_BaseControllable_UnityEvents.cs.meta; VRTK_Button_UnityEvents.cs; VRTK_SharedMethods.cs

author: Harvey Ball
message:
feat(Interaction): add artificial pusher controllable

The Artificial Pusher is a simulated pusher that uses no Unity
physics to move the pusher. It has fewer features than the
Physics Pusher but won't have the issues that the physics system
can cause.
files_changed: API.md; 025_Controls_Overview.unity; ButtonReactor.cs; Artificial.meta; VRTK_ArtificialPusher.cs; VRTK_ArtificialPusher.cs.meta; VRTK_PhysicsPusher.cs; VRTK_BaseControllable.cs; VRTK_SharedMethods.cs

author: Harvey Ball
message:
feat(Interaction): add physics rotator controllable

The Physics Rotator controllable creates an interactable object
that is attached to a hinge joint and can be rotated around
the hinge joint upon grab and movement of the controller.

The joint position is determined by a specified transform which
removes any magic setup and allows for greater control.

The Door, Chest, Lever and Spring Lever 3D Controls have now been
deprecated as they can be recreated with the new physics rotator
controllable.
files_changed: API.md; 025_Controls_Overview.unity; VRTK_ContentHandler.cs; VRTK_Chest.cs; VRTK_Chest.cs.meta; VRTK_Door.cs; VRTK_Door.cs.meta; VRTK_Knob.cs; VRTK_Knob.cs.meta; VRTK_Lever.cs; VRTK_Lever.cs.meta; VRTK_SpringLever.cs; VRTK_SpringLever.cs.meta; VRTK_BasePhysicsControllable.cs; VRTK_PhysicsPusher.cs; VRTK_PhysicsRotator.cs; VRTK_PhysicsRotator.cs.meta; VRTK_BaseControllable.cs; VRTK_SharedMethods.cs

author: Harvey Ball
message:
feat(Interaction): add physics slider controllable

The 3D Control Slider has now been deprecated for the new Physics
Slider Controllable. It offers a simpler solution that enables the
script to be enabled and disabled at runtime with correct cleanup.

It no longer auto detects the direction of the slider and works on
the specified operating axis.

Due to the way the Physics Slider script works means the Drawer
3D Control can easily be recreated with the Physics Slider script
and therefore the 3D Control Drawer has also been deprecated.
files_changed: API.md; 025_Controls_Overview.unity; VRTK_Drawer.cs; VRTK_Drawer.cs.meta; VRTK_Slider.cs; VRTK_Slider.cs.meta; VRTK_BasePhysicsControllable.cs; VRTK_PhysicsSlider.cs; VRTK_PhysicsSlider.cs.meta

author: Harvey Ball
message:
feat(Interaction): add artificial slider controllable

The Artificial Slider is a simulated slider that uses no Unity physics
to slide the control around. It utilises the Move Transform Grab
Mechanic and simulates as much as the Physics Slider control as
possible but without the need for joints and rigidbodies.
files_changed: API.md; 025_Controls_Overview.unity; ControlReactor.cs; VRTK_ContentHandler.cs; VRTK_ContentHandler.cs.meta; VRTK_Control.cs; VRTK_Control.cs.meta; VRTK_ArtificialSlider.cs; VRTK_ArtificialSlider.cs.meta; VRTK_BaseGrabAttach.cs; VRTK_MoveTransformGrabAttach.cs; VRTK_Button_UnityEvents.cs; VRTK_Button_UnityEvents.cs.meta; VRTK_Control_UnityEvents.cs; VRTK_Control_UnityEvents.cs.meta

author: Harvey Ball
message:
chore(Structure): remove var usage

A number of files contained `var` declarations for variables and this
is something that is being phased out of the code guidelines for the
project.

This commit removes existing `var` declarations.

author: Harvey Ball
message:
feat(SDK): add new headset types and move to base headset sdk

The Headsets enum has been moved from the DeviceFinder to the
SDK BaseHeadset script to keep in line with the controllers enum
being in the SDK BaseController script.

Additional Headset types have been added for GearVR supported devices
and for Daydream and Cardboard. As Google devices don't report
differences between the devices the summary and detail both return
the same response of `Daydream` or `GoogleCardboard`.
files_changed: API.md; SDK_BaseHeadset.cs; SDK_SteamVRController.cs; SDK_UnityController.cs; VRTK_DeviceFinder.cs; VRTK_SDKObjectState.cs

author: Harvey Ball
message:
feat(Locomotion): ability to move, rotate, scale play area by dragging

The Drag World script mimics the movement mechanic popularised in
Sports Bar VR (Hulk Mode) or in Tilt Brush and Google Blocks, where the
PlayArea can be moved, rotated and scaled based on dragging and
grabbing the world with the controllers and moving them in a certain
way to determine the appropriate mechanism to be performed.

A new custom data type has been created that allows the state of a
Vector3 to contain boolean information, this is used in this case for
knowing which axis on the Vector3 to lock, but could also be used
for other boolean information relating to a Vector3.
files_changed: API.md; DataTypes.meta; Vector3StateDrawer.cs; Vector3StateDrawer.cs.meta; DataTypes.meta; Vector3State.cs; Vector3State.cs.meta; VRTK_DragWorld.cs; VRTK_DragWorld.cs.meta

author: Harvey Ball
message:
fix(Internal): move property extensions script to editor directory

The Serialized Property Extensions script has been moved to the Editor
directory so it doesn't get included in builds as it would cause a
build to crash and it's only used by the Editor scripts anyway.

author: Harvey Ball
message:
feat(Utilities): add track object option to rigidbody follow

The Rigidbody Follow script now has a `Track` option for the Movement
Option. The track option uses the same mechanic as the track object
grab mechanic to make a rigidbody track another rigidbody based on
the velocity differences and use MoveTowards to move the rigidbody
velocity towards the intended target.

author: Harvey Ball
message:
feat(Interaction): add tracked controller colliders

The Controller Tracked Collider script provides a way of having
decoupled controller colliders from the actual controller GameObject.

This means that the tracked collider collection is not a child of the
controller GameObject so it does not have absolute 1:1 tracking. This
is useful as it means the colliders do not follow the controller to
every specific position and because it uses Rigidbody mechanics to
move the collider collection, the colliders interact within the Unity
physics system.

This results in being able to pass a controller through another
Rigidbody but the colliders for the controller won't pass through with
the controller, instead they will be restricted by the Unity physics
system.

The Controller Rigidbody Activator script has also been updated to
allow it to activate these new tracked controller colliders.

The Ignore Interact Touch Colliders script has also been updated to
ensure these tracked controller colliders are also included in the
ignore routine as they are effectively tied to the Interact Touch
collider set.
files_changed: API.md; VRTK_ControllerRigidbodyActivator.cs; VRTK_IgnoreInteractTouchColliders.cs; VRTK_ControllerHighlighter.cs; VRTK_ControllerTrackedCollider.cs; VRTK_ControllerTrackedCollider.cs.meta; VRTK_InteractGrab.cs; VRTK_InteractTouch.cs; VRTK_ObjectAutoGrab.cs; VRTK_ObjectCache.cs

author: Harvey Ball
message:
chore(Interaction): remove physics controllable auto interaction option

The Physics Controllables previously had an `Auto Interaction` option
which would automatically create a Controller Rigidbody Activator on
the control if one was not already present.

This caused a number of issues where the Rigidbody Activator collider
was not of the correct size and would lead to confusion with the
controls. The simplest solution is to just remove the mechanism all
together and expect the Rigidbody Activator prefab to be added
manually when it's required.

Example scene 25 has been updated to reflect this change.
files_changed: API.md; 025_Controls_Overview.unity; VRTK_ArtificialRotator.cs; VRTK_BasePhysicsControllable.cs; VRTK_PhysicsRotator.cs; VRTK_PhysicsSlider.cs; VRTK_RigidbodyFollow.cs

author: Harvey Ball
message:
fix(UIPointer): exit events per element

The VRInputModule script would not fire `UIPointerElementExit` if the
pointer landed on a new element instead of nothing. This fix makes
sure to fire the exit event on any existing `hoveringElement` before
firing enter on the new element. The other case for the exit event
firing is left as is as it handles the situation where you move off
all elements and there are no results or target.

Thanks to @kristianpd for this work.

author: Harvey Ball
message:
feat(Interaction): expose max distance delta parameter on track grab

The Track Object Grab Mechanic had an internal parameter for the
Max Distance Delta used within the MoveTowards method. However, this
was always set to `10f` but on occasion it was prudent to change this
value to something else. The simplest solution is to just expose this
parameter to allow the user to set it to what they need it to be.

author: Harvey Ball
message:
feat(SDK): utilise underlying sdk to retrieve headset type

Previously, the `VRTK_DeviceFinder.GetHeadsetType()` would rely on the
built in Unity methods for determining the headset type, however this
was unsustainable as it didn't report generic enough information and
would mean the list of headset types would grow and grow and ultimately
not provide useful information.

This has now been changed by each SDK now has a `GetHeadsetType` method
that reports a simpler to understand headset type string, so in the
case of the vive, it does not report all of the variants, just reports
"htcvive" and similarly with the rift.

This string is then used to return a new, cleaner enum from the
`VRTK_DeviceFinder.GetHeadsetType()` method and the enum is stored
in the SDK_BaseHeadset class as it's more appropriate.

The usage of `GetHeadsetType` to determine which controller is
connected in the SDK_SteamVRController class has been removed and
now the render model of the connected controller is used to determine
the controller type as this will always be accurate from what OpenVR
is reporting.

When using the Unity SDK, the headset is still retrieved in the old
way as Unity doesn't provide enough decent information about the
connected headset to know which device is actually connected. It
does this by scraping the model and device name.
files_changed: API.md; SDK_BaseHeadset.cs; SDK_DaydreamHeadset.cs; SDK_FallbackHeadset.cs; SDK_HyperealVRHeadset.cs; SDK_OculusHeadset.cs; SDK_SimHeadset.cs; SDK_SteamVRController.cs; SDK_SteamVRHeadset.cs; SDK_UnityController.cs; SDK_UnityHeadset.cs; VRTK_SDK_Bridge.cs; SDK_XimmerseHeadset.cs; VRTK_DeviceFinder.cs; VRTK_SDKObjectState.cs

author: Harvey Ball
message:
refactor(Structure): provide helper methods for lists and dictionaries

There are a number of places where the use of a List or Dictionary has
unnecessary repetition in checking if a value or key is present before
either adding or removing from the list or dictionary.

There are also times where a value is attempted to be retrieved from
a dictionary but it doesn't exist which would then need to be added
so multiple dictionary lookups are done, which is inefficient. The
proposed changes ensure a single look up is done via `TryGetValue`
which will reduce dictionary usage overhead.

Some places that used lists and cared about not having duplicates but
didn't care about list order have been updated to use a `HashSet`
which by default doesn't allow duplicates so there is no need for
an unnecessary `Contains` check. Some scripts iterated through
the `List` with a `for` loop which is not possible with a `HashSet`
so they have been replaced with a `foreach` loop as this shouldn't
cause any efficiency issues in Unity 5.6 and above.
files_changed: API.md; VRTK_IndependentRadialMenuController.cs; VRTK_RadialMenu.cs; VRTK_SnapDropZone.cs; SDK_SimController.cs; SDK_SteamVRController.cs; SDK_UnityController.cs; VRTK_BaseHighlighter.cs; VRTK_MaterialColorSwapHighlighter.cs; VRTK_MaterialPropertyBlockColorSwapHighlighter.cs; VRTK_OutlineObjectCopyHighlighter.cs; VRTK_IgnoreInteractTouchColliders.cs; VRTK_InteractObjectAppearance.cs; VRTK_InteractableObject.cs; VRTK_ObjectTouchAutoInteract.cs; VRTK_ControllerHighlighter.cs; VRTK_ControllerTrackedCollider.cs; VRTK_InteractNearTouch.cs; VRTK_InteractTouch.cs; VRTK_ControllerHaptics.cs; VRTK_ObjectAppearance.cs; VRTK_ControllerReference.cs; VRTK_Logger.cs; VRTK_UIGraphicRaycaster.cs; VRTK_MoveInPlace.cs; VRTK_BasePointerRenderer.cs; VRTK_BodyPhysics.cs; VRTK_UIPointer.cs; VRTK_SDKInfo.cs; VRTK_SharedMethods.cs

author: Harvey Ball
message:
feat(Interaction): remove highlighting duty from interactable obejct

The Interactable Object is no longer responsible for causing the object
to highlight. All of the highlighting code within the Interactable
Object script has now been removed or deprecated. The Interact
Object Highlight script now takes full control of highlighting an
object and it has been improved so it can listen for the events on an
interactable object and affect the highlighting of a different object.

author: Harvey Ball
message:
refactor(ControllerEvents): relocate vector2 axis types from sdk

The Vector2Axis from the BaseController script has now been moved to
the Controller Events script as it's only really used by the
controller events and it also requires an `Undefined` state which
wouldn't make sense in the BaseController enum.

author: Harvey Ball
message:
fix(Interaction): allow controllables to be moved without breaking

The Controllables, specifically the Physics based ones were not working
correctly if they were moved in the scene and then disabled/re-enabled
due to how the position was being calculated based on the original
scene position being used to determine the joint set up. The original
position was being re-set every time the object was enabled which was
partially the issue, but also the original position was not being
taken into consideration when updating the transform local position.

author: Harvey Ball
message:
refactor(Pointers): move activation button logic to separate method

The activation logic has been moved from the button callback method
to it's own separate method as this helps decouple the logic.

author: Harvey Ball
message:
refactor(Structure): move obsolete parameters to bottom of inspector

The obsolete parameters are now all grouped at the bottom of the script
inspector window and under the header `Obsolete Settings` to make it
easier to identify deprecated variables.
files_changed: VRTK_ControllerTooltips.cs; VRTK_SnapDropZone.cs; VRTK_SDKManagerEditor.cs; VRTK_AxisScaleGrabAction.cs; VRTK_InteractObjectHighlighter.cs; VRTK_InteractableObject.cs; VRTK_BasicTeleport.cs; VRTK_Pointer.cs; VRTK_UIPointer.cs; VRTK_SDKManager.cs

author: Harvey Ball
message:
chore(README.md): remove references to patreon

As the Patreon account has now been shut down, all references to the
patreon and the credits has been removed.

author: Harvey Ball
message:
fix(Examples): use final scene index for constructor scene

Previously, the constructor scene was injected into the
AdditiveSceneLoader component as a `Object` type and then the `name`
of this object was used to identify the constructor scene which worked
fine when running in the Unity Editor but would fail in a build.

This is most likely because the `Object` type is not being injected
in a build and only works due to quirks in the editor.

The solution is now to ensure the final scene in Build Settings is the
constructor scene and then simply to use that index in the
AdditiveSceneLoader component and remove the ability to inject a scene.

author: Harvey Ball
message:
fix(Examples): ensure constructor scene is available in build settings

Previously, the constructor scene was removed from being injected into
the example scenes as it wasn't working in a build, instead the
constructor scene was required to be the last scene in the build
settings and was loaded in by index.

This only worked if using the project settings from the VRTK repo but
would not work if VRTK was imported into another project.

To remedy this, the scene injection is now being used again and the
last scene index is being used as a fallback. If no scene is in the
build settings then the script will attempt to add it as the last
scene automatically.

author: Harvey Ball
message:
chore(Structure): remove script define symbols from project settings

The Project Settings should not have any default script define symbols
as these should be automatically added by the SDK Manager.

author: Harvey Ball
message:
refactor(PolicyList): provide alternative for deprecated EnumMaskField

The `EnumMaskField` method on the `EditorGUILayout` class has been
deprecated in Unity 2017.3 and replaced with `EnumFlagsField`.

This short refactor just ensures the deprecated method is only used
in older versions of Unity where it is still supported.

Thanks to @qubytes for the fix.

author: Harvey Ball
message:
fix(Examples): remove script define symbol check and provide popup

The previous way of attempting to notify the user that they need to
open the example constructor scene before opening any of the example
scenes did not work if no 3rd party SDK was installed that required
it. It would simply just continually throw the error message.

The new solution is not to try and second guess what the set up is
automatically and to just provide a popup window with information
for the user on requiring them to open the constructor example scene.

author: JWNJWN
message:
fix(Highlighter): copy shadow casting mode from object renderer

The shadow casting mode is now copied over from the object's renderer.
Also removed an unnessesary duplicate if statement.

author: JWNJWN
message:
fix(highlighter): index out of range

Wrong array length was being used.

Also re-added the if statement I removed in a previous commit.
because i'm dumb.

author: JWNJWN
message:
fix(TransformModify): SteamVR Dashboard reset

Removed the reliance on the model being active

author: Harvey Ball
message:
fix(structure): remove unwanted Assets directory

The Assets directory was accidentally merged in from master but it
has now been removed.

author: Harvey Ball
message:
chore(Examples): remove additive scene loading

The additive scene loading constructor scene causes too much
confusion to people using the example scenes so the additive loaded
SDK Manager has now been deleted and the SDK Manager and CameraRig
setup exists per scene.

author: Harvey Ball
message:
fix(Examples): remove unused event listeners from button presses

A number of the button presses had event listeners that were not
registered to any action. These have now been removed.

author: Harvey Ball
message:
chore(Core): update core submodule to latest head

The Core submodule brings changes to the way interactables emit their
first/last touch/grab events as well as updated interactable prefabs.

The Core also now has all of the new BodyRepresentation functionality
plus the Climb and Axis move functionality with associated prefabs.

author: Harvey Ball
message:
feat(Examples): add locomotion and climbing example scene

The Locomotion example scene showcases body representation which
provides a physical representation of the player's body in virtual
space and can be used to prevent walking through walls and determine
collisions and when the player becomes diverged from their virtual
representation (e.g. by walking in real life through a virtual wall).

The example scene also contains a demo of the climbing prefab along
with a basic version of an axis control to move the play area around
with the touchpad/thumbstick.

author: Harvey Ball
message:
feat(Examples): add headset fade on collision

The Movement Locomotion scene has been updated with a collider that
tracks the HMD position and when it collides with something else
such as a wall, it will fade the headset color to black and will
unfade when the collision stops.

author: Harvey Ball
message:
feat(Examples): add rotation and warp locomotion

The Movement example scene now has an example of how to rotate the
play area with an axis and also how to do a warp and snap rotation
movement where it moves/rotates the play area in a single jump with
a camera fade in between for comfort.

author: Christopher - Marcel Bddecker
message:
chore(Dependencies): move Zinnia into dependencies folder

Zinnia is a dependency of VRTK and as such it has been moved into a
`Dependencies` folder to emphasize the relationship between the two
projects.

author: Christopher - Marcel Bddecker
message:
chore(Dependencies): adapt to the latest Zinnia

Public API changes of the latest update to Zinnia include a move
from fields to properties which this change adapts the VRTK codebase
to.

Assembly Definition Files (ADFs) have been added and the necessary
dependencies on them have been configured. This change speeds up the
compilation times.

author: Christopher - Marcel Bddecker
message:
chore(structure): remove redundant using directives

Using statements that "import" types and members that are not used
are unnecessary. This change removes them.

author: Christopher - Marcel Bddecker
message:
chore(conventions): remove redundant member initializers

They are against the code conventions used as the implicit default
value is the same.

author: Christopher - Marcel Bddecker
message:
chore(structure): remove unnecessary whitespace

Lines that used whitespace where none adds to the general
indentation were removed to clean up the codebase. According to the
code conventions empty lines right after a type or method definition
are unwanted. This change also removes those.

author: Christopher - Marcel Bddecker
message:
chore(structure): fix typos in comments and identifiers

Some identifiers and comments had typos or used British English
while the convention is to use American English.

BREAKING CHANGE: Some identifiers have been renamed that are
serialized by Unity and thus prefabs and other assets need to be
updated to use the latest spelling of the identifiers.

author: Harvey Ball
message:
fix(examples): remove empty event listeners from options prefab

The options prefab had empty event listeners in the enable/disable
options. These have been deleted from the default prefab and added
as overrides to the options prefab in the farmyard example scene.

author: Harvey Ball
message:
fix(examples): remove pitchfork prefab

The pitchfork prefab did not work well in the scene and had a bad mesh
on the model causing too much trouble. It's easier to just remove it
now and potentially introduce something similar in the future.

author: Harvey Ball
message:
feat(examples): add outer gate to farm scene

There is now an outer gate on the farm scene along with a couple of
other cleanups and movements of objects in the scene.

author: Harvey Ball
message:
feat(Interactions): add rotation by position change follow type

A new grab action has been added that causes the target's rotation to
change based on the position difference of the source.

This allows a controller to move in a circular motion around an object
to create an artificial rotation.

author: Harvey Ball
message:
refactor(Interactions): move common drive functions to abstract classes

The appropriate methods and parameters in the controllable drives have
been reorganised so common functionality is done in the abstract
classes rather than the concrete classes so this code can be reused
in other implementations of the relevant drives.
files_changed: DirectionalDrive.cs; DirectionalJointDrive.cs; Drive.cs; DriveAxis.cs; DriveFacade.cs; RotationalDrive.cs; RotationalDriveFacade.cs; RotationalJointDrive.cs

author: Harvey Ball
message:
feat(Interactions): add artificial directional drive

The DirectionalTransformDrive provides the same API as the
DirectionalJointDrive however it uses no physics, joints or rigidbodies
and therefore is not affected by any artifacts that the physics system
can apply to the control.

The DirectionalTransformDrive moves the control through directly
manipulating the Transform of the GameObject.

author: Christopher - Marcel Bddecker
message:
chore(Helpers): remove unused using statement

A using statement that is no longer used has been removed to clean
up the codebase.

author: Christopher - Marcel Bddecker
message:
perf(general): reduce heap allocations by removing LINQ usages

Heap allocations are garbage-collected which is an issue for
real-time applications. To ensure the best performance is available
to a user of VRTK this change removes most usages of LINQ. `foreach`
loops are left in as there are no garbage allocations in recent
versions of Unity thanks to the upgraded compiler it's targeting
nowadays.
files_changed: TrackedAliasFacade.cs; TrackedAliasInternalSetup.cs; GrabInteractableSetInteractorProvider.cs; GrabInteractableStackInteractorProvider.cs; GrabInteractableReceiver.cs; TouchInteractableInternalSetup.cs; BodyRepresentationInternalSetup.cs; ClimbFacade.cs; ClimbInternalSetup.cs; TeleporterInternalSetup.cs

author: Christopher - Marcel Bddecker
message:
perf(Interactions): remove non-accessed field

A field in `RotationDrive` was assigned but was never read from.
Since it also was `protected` there could have been no usage of that
field thus this change removes it.

author: Harvey Ball
message:
chore(tests): remove TestHelper scene

The TestHelper scene is no longer required as the Zinnia tests run
in play mode which creates a brand new temporary scene to run the
tests in. The instructions for how to run the tests has also been
removed from the README.md as this is really only a thing for Zinnia.

author: Harvey Ball
message:
feat(Interactions): remove moment processor polling for kinematic logic

The FollowAction used a MomentProcessor to poll in the LateUpdate to
see whether to turn on or off the kinematic logic when grabbing and
releasing an interactable.

This doesn't need to be polled with a MomentProcessor as the change of
tracking type already executes a code block, so this kinematic logic
has now been moved to the reactive code block instead which makes
the checking a lot more efficient.

author: Harvey Ball
message:
feat(examples): add zip wire

The zip wire is a climbable object that once grabbed plays an animation
which moves the grabbed object along a path to simulate a zip wire.

author: Harvey Ball
message:
feat(Pointers): rename parabolic to curved

The Parabolic pointer naming is confusing as it's referred to in
numerous places as either parabolic or bezier with neither being
consistent. To resolve this, it's simply been renamed curved to reduce
confusion.

author: Harvey Ball
message:
fix(examples): ensure locomotion state is enabled after falling

There was an issue with the locomotion state not being re-enabled when
throwing yourself after climbing and falling due to the timers calling
cancel but if the timer had already completed then the cancel event
would never emit and the locomotion would never be re-enabled.

There was also another issue where the climbing prefab would disable
the entire Movement GameObject meaning the movement state logic
may not run in time. This logic has now been moved out of the
Movement GameObject so it is never disabled.

author: Christopher - Marcel Bddecker
message:
chore(Interactables): remove unused using statements

Redundant using statements have been removed as the namespace they
import is no longer used in the respective type.

author: Harvey Ball
message:
fix(CameraRig): use updated position mutator property on simulator

The TransformPositionMutator property for dealing with the direction
to move the Target has been updated in Zinnia from `RotationalOffset`
to `FacingDirection`.

As the SimulatedCameraRig used this property previously, it means the
setting had been deleted due to the property name change. This fix
adds the references back in.

author: Harvey Ball
message:
fix(Interactions): ensure directional drive works in local space

The DirectionalTransformDrive would not work if it was nested to
another interactable object and the MoveToTargetValue was true
because the TransformPropertyApplier would always work in world space
which meant the drive was never calculating the correct position.

Now it's possible to work in local space which resolves this issue.

The directional and rotational drive also had an issue where they
would re-enable the rigidbody kinematic state when ungrabbed due to
the default behaviour of the Interactable. This has been configured
to never emit the rigidbody kinematic change events for either drive
as they should not be changing the kinematic states.

The Interactable Consumer Rigidbody can also now be null and the
relevant code that uses it will perform a null check. This won't
work for nested interactables because there will be no collision
catch rigidbody, however if a non-nested interactable is required
without a kinematic rigidbody, then this should allow for that.

author: Harvey Ball
message:
chore(Dependencies): update Zinnia submodule to latest head

The latest changes to Zinnia bring some structural changes which
mean namespaces have changed causing a range of errors which have
been fixed by providing the new namespaces.

The ComponentGameObjectEmitter was also renamed to
ComponentGameObjectExtractor which has been updated in any class
that inherited from this.
files_changed: Zinnia.Unity; PlayAreaRepresentationConfigurator.cs; ActiveObjectController.cs; SimulatorFacade.cs; AxisRotatorConfigurator.cs; TrackedColliderConfigurator.cs; InteractorHapticsConfigurator.cs; ClimbInteractableConfigurator.cs; GrabInteractableAction.cs; GrabInteractableControlDirectionAction.cs; GrabInteractableInteractorProvider.cs; GrabInteractableListInteractorProvider.cs; GrabInteractableStackInteractorProvider.cs; GrabInteractableReceiver.cs; InteractableFacadeEventProxyEmitter.cs; TouchInteractableConfigurator.cs; InteractorVisibilityModifier.prefab; InteractorFacadeObservableList.cs; GrabInteractorConfigurator.cs; InteractorExtractor.cs; InteractorFacadeEventProxyEmitter.cs; AxesToVector3Processor.cs; ClimbVelocityApplier.cs; MovementAmplifierConfigurator.cs

author: Harvey Ball
message:
refactor(Interactions): move InteractorVisibilityModifier to top level

The InteractorVisibilityModifier has been moved out of the Interactors
namespace and into the top level Interactions namespace as it is
technically its own prefab and shouldn't really be nested as it just
creates more mess in the prefabs sub directories.
files_changed: InteractorVisibilityModifier.meta; InteractorVisibilityModifier.prefab; InteractorVisibilityModifier.prefab.meta; SharedResources.meta; Scripts.meta; InteractorVisibilityModifierFacade.cs; InteractorVisibilityModifierFacade.cs.meta

author: Harvey Ball
message:
refactor(Interactions): move climb facade script inside climb namespace

The ClimbInteractableFacade script was previously sitting at the top
level of the Interactables namespace even though the Configurator was
at the lower level Climb namespace. The Facade has now been moved to
be along side the Configurator.

author: Harvey Ball
message:
feat(Interactions): extract common references from Interactables

The InteractableFacade can now have the ConsumerContainer and the
ConsumerRigidbody properties extracted and emitted via a
GameObjectExtractor implementation to make it easy to retrieve the
appropriate elements from the InteractableFacade.

author: Harvey Ball
message:
feat(Pointers): expose pointer events on facade

The PointerFacade now exposes the ObjectPointer events and therefore
the ObjectPointer is moved to a lower level of the prefab hierarchy
to make the Pointer prefabs cleaner.
files_changed: ObjectPointer.Curved.prefab; ObjectPointer.Straight.prefab; ObjectPointer.Internal.prefab; PointerConfigurator.cs; PointerFacade.cs; ExampleScene.unity

author: Harvey Ball
message:
feat(examples): add ability to use pointer to pick up objects

Two new StraightPointers have been added to follow each controller
alias and if the controller Interactor isn't touching anything then
pointers become available and will activate when the grab button is
pressed and emit a straight pointer from the relevant interactor.

If the pointer touches something and then the grab button is released
then the Interactable the pointer is touching is grabbed to the
Interactor that is emitting the pointer.

It's not prudent to allow grabbing everything at a distance, such as
doors and drawers so new rules have been set up to prevent certain
items from being grabbed, but also previously Interactables were put
on the `Ignore Raycast` layer as so the teleporter Pointers wouldn't
interact with them, this then creates an issue with the Grab Pointers
as they will also by default just pass through anything on the
"Ignore Raycast" layer.

To solve this, the Interactables that want to be grabbed have been
moved on to the "Water" layer and a rule has been added so they only
consider anything on the Water layer as a valid target.

The Teleporter Pointers have a custom PhysicsCast to ensure they now
ignore anything on both `Ignore Raycast` and `Water` layer so the
pointer grabbable Interactables still ignore the teleporter pointers.

The reason the `Water` layer was used was it is a default layer that
comes with Unity and it's just an example scene, in practice it would
be better to define a specific new layer in the Unity project but as
VRTK doesn't auto specify custom layers then this is not feasible.
files_changed: GrabPointerInvalid.mat; GrabPointerInvalid.mat.meta; GrabPointerValid.mat; GrabPointerValid.mat.meta; Apple Variant.prefab; ExampleScene.unity

author: Harvey Ball
message:
fix(CameraRig): use appropriate targets for controlling simulator

The SimulatedCameraRig didn't correctly represent how an actual
VR CameraRig is set up. The need to inject the TrackedAlias to
move the simulator rig around is incorrect and in fact the simulator
should not be allowing the movement of the CameraRig (play area)
as this is not something that happens with actual VR rigs. Instead
a player can walk around their play area but this is just moving their
headset and controller tracked avatars within the play area and then
the play area is moved via other mechanisms.

This fix removes the need to inject a TrackedAlias into the Simulator
and now the movement only controls the position of the headset within
the play area.

The speed that the simulated avatar objects can now also be set on the
SimulatorFacade.

author: Harvey Ball
message:
feat(examples): ignore collisions between interactors

As Interactors have a CollisionTracker on them it can cause an issue
where the CollisionTracker on one interactor notifies the
CollisionTracker on the other interactor of a collision between each
other and potentially create an unwanted cyclic reference.

This just adds a CollisionIgnorer to remove the collisions between
the left and right Interactor.

author: Harvey Ball
message:
fix(Pointers): ensure correct order for pointer actions

There was a race condition where the activation action could be
registered before the selection action meaning doing things like
select on release would not work as the activation action was
being called before the selection action so the pointer would be
disabled before it could select anything.

This fix moves around some of the registration logic to ensure
the correct order for actions.

author: Harvey Ball
message:
feat(structure): utilise observable list property drawer for tidiness

The new ObservableList property drawer means ObservableList elements
can be displayed inline on components that reference an ObservableList
which means these required components can now be moved and hidden
inside the internal parts of prefabs, which tidies up the top level
facade.

Some linkages will break due to some components now moving to new
GameObject, such as TrackedAlias and CameraRigSwitcher will need
re-configuring in existing scenes (and have been re-configured in the
example scene).
files_changed: CameraRigSwitcher.prefab; TrackedAliasFacade.cs; TrackedAlias.prefab; CollisionFader.prefab; CollisionIgnorer.prefab; ObjectFollower.prefab; InteractorHaptics.prefab; InteractorHapticsFacade.cs; BodyRepresentationFacade.cs; Climb.prefab; Teleporter.Dash.prefab; Teleporter.Instant.prefab; ExampleScene.unity

author: Harvey Ball
message:
feat(Interactions): extract InteractableFacade from given GameObject

The InteractableFacadeExtractor allows a given GameObject to be checked
to see if an InteractableFacade exists within its ancestor or
descendant hierarchy and if it does then it emits the found
InteractableFacade.

author: Harvey Ball
message:
fix(Interactions): track all active collisions on interactable

The Interactable now tracks all objects that are colliding with it via
a GameObject Observable List regardless of whether the object is a
valid interactor. This collisions list can be used to determine what
non interactor objects are touching the interactable for any number
of reasons, one specific reason is to ensure a SnapZone can determine
which interactables are touching which SnapZones without needing to
have an implicit reference on the Interactable.

Common functionality across the different Interactable prefabs has
also been moved into a Common prefab so if generic functionality
changes then it is automatically reflected across all Interactable
prefabs.

author: Harvey Ball
message:
fix(Interactions): remove invalid SnapZone collisions from interactable

It was possible for an Interactable collision list to be populated with
a SnapZone due to the way the SnapZone forcibly populates the
Interactable Collision list when checking if it can activate. On most
occasions this is handled by the collision exit code, however on rare
occasion it may forego this operation and mean the Interactable thinks
it is still colliding with a SnapZone that it no longer is. This fix
checks to see if the collision is valid and if it's not then it
forcibly removes it to ensure the state is correct.

author: Christopher - Marcel Bddecker
message:
fix(examples): remove unnecessary Vector2ComponentExtractor

The Vector2ComponentExtractor component is unnecessary because it is
providing the same functionality as the Vector2ToFloat component.

So the Vector2ComponentExtractor component has been removed from the
scene where it was being used in the:
`VRTK Prefabs -> Controller Actions -> RightController -> Pointers ->
SimulatedRotator -> OutputAxes -> SimulatedHorizontal/Vertical`

for extracting the Vector2 element into a float value. This can simply
be achieved by converting the Vector2 to a float and defining the
coordinate to convert to the output float.

author: extendreality
message:
feat(examples): add axis movement and pseudo body tracking

The axis movement locomotion has been added where the left stick
walks forwards and backwards and strafes left and right, whereas the
right stick warps forwards and backwards and rotates left and right.

The PseudoBody prefab has also been added to prevent walking through
solid objects.

author: extendreality
message:
feat(examples): add climbable zipwire component

The zipwire is a climbable component that also moves along a
pre-determined animation path so the climb will follow the path
of the zipwire.

author: extendreality
message:
feat(examples): add step multiplier locomotion option

The step multiplier locomotion option has been added by adding
the movement amplifier prefab.

author: Harvey Ball
message:
fix(Input): ensure axis input values are processed correctly

There was an issue where the axis input values would not process
the latest axis input if the input moved too quickly.

This has been fixed in the latest version of the Tilia UnityInputSystem
package and those changes have been migrated into the farmyard scene.

author: Harvey Ball
message:
feat(Malimbe): remove malimbe dependency

BREAKING CHANGE: This removes the last remaining elements of
Malimbe and whilst it does not cause any breaking changes within
this package, it removes Malimbe as a dependency which other projects
that rely on this package may piggy back off this Malimbe dependency
so it will break any project like that.

All of the previous functionality from Malimbe has been replicated in
standard code without the need for it to be weaved by the Malimbe
helper tags.

Also significantly refactored InputControlSetup to
simplify a lot of it. Allocations aren't ideal yet.

author: Tom Baird
message:
CHANGE: Remove XR state structs (#66)

* Migrating XR Utils to public, forked repo in preparation for PR.

* Fixed Merge issues affecting compilation.

* Moved XR to Plugins Folder and enabled XR devices in Editor (will investigate other platforms).

* Fixed XRController Reference in FunctionalTests

* Added missing using Statement for the XRController

* First pass PR feedback, + Formatting pass

* Converted SimpleXRRumble to a struct

* Used Template Parenting to avoid having to set explicit device offsets

* Replaced XRTemplateBuilderMatching for InputDeviceDescriptor matching

* Added Before Render to base XR types to avoid having to set every time.

* Added basic Vive support

* Added Knuckles controller support

* Removed unused using statements

* Setting the parentLayout on the builder to it extends properly

* Removed the BeforeRender setting on the InputControlLayout attribute because I don't yet think it's well thought out.

* Removal of attribute

author: jonas echterhoff
message:
Remove runInBackground (#490)

`InputSettings.runInBackground` has been removed. This should now be supported or not on a per-device level. Most devices never supported it in the first place, so a global setting did not seem to be useful.

author: jonas echterhoff
message:
Generate input action map in wrapper (#496)

- Generated wrapper code for Input Action Assets are now self-contained, generating all the data from code and not needing a reference to the asset; `InputActionAssetReference` has been removed.
	- The option to generate interfaces on wrappers has been removed, instead we always do this now.
	- The option to generate events on wrappers has been removed, we felt that this no longer made sense.
	- Will now show default values in Input Action inspector if no custom values for file path, class name or namespace have been provided.

author: Karl Jones
message:
Handle parent directory renaming whilst asset is being edited. (#1049)

* Added test to ensure that an exception is not thrown when Saving input asset and the parent directory was renamed. (case 1207527)

* Removed cached asset path. We now use the asset guid to get the path when requested. (case 1207527)

When the parent directory is renamed the path becomes invalid. Its much safer to use the asset guid and resolve the path when its requested. There is no continuous use of the path in code so it should not have any performance impact.

* Code Formatting

* Discard the unused argument.

Fixes a warning.

* Ignore warning CA1801

* Test the file has been modified instead of an exception not being thrown.

We should test for the behaviour we actually want.

* Added CHANGELOG entry

* Use the [Unreleased] header instead of a unreleased version and date

author: benoit-alain
message:
Fixed case 1369081. When using SingleUnifiedPointer, the same pointer (#1416)

* Fixed case 1369081. When using SingleUnifiedPointer, the same pointerId should be sent to UIToolkit regardless of pointer type or finger id.

* Added unit test and changelog entry for case 1369081 fix.

* Corrected merge error

* Replaced internal URL with external URL for case in CHANGELOG

* Fixed test UI_CanOperateUIToolkitInterface_UsingInputSystemUIInputModule for 2021.2.
It turns out the button occupies the entire screen vertically, so using an outside coordinate to the right of the button is more stable than to the bottom of it.

* Attempted to fix null exception in OnDisable on Yamato during UITK test.

* Set fixed sized parent for UITKTestSceneDocument content to avoid tests depending on screen resolution.

* Third attempt at fixing UI Toolkit test. Moved the mouse out of the way.

* Added checks to find where the test diverges between Win and Mac.

Co-authored-by: Hkan Sidenvall <hakan.sidenvall@unity3d.com>

author: Chris Massie
message:
FIX: NullReferenceException when using Prefab Overrides window (#1567)

* Fixed InputActionDrawerBase not initializing the TreeView correctly

- This change makes sure the TreeView.serializedObject matches the property.
The value was null which was causing `OnGUI` to throw an exception.
- The change to `UpdateSerializedObjectDirtyCount` was not necessary for this
fix but it should protect against cases where the serializedObject becomes
null for some reason. The `EditorUtility.GetDirtyCount` method returns 0
when the argument is null, so this seems like the appropriate thing to do.

* CHANGE: move changelog entry into next release

Co-authored-by: Hkan Sidenvall <hakan.sidenvall@unity3d.com>
Co-authored-by: James McGill <james.mcgill@unity3d.com>

author: Chris Massie
message:
FIX: Fix TrackedPoseDriver serialization migration (ISXB-512, ISXB-521) (#1705)

* Fixed serialization migration in TrackedPoseDriver when prefabs are used

- Removed the no longer necessary m_HasMigratedActions field since it only copies over from the old deprecated fields if the new property has not been initialized.
- This fix still does not fix the issue of nested prefabs where the parent prefab has an override to add a new input binding. The base prefab will already have the InputActionProperty upgraded, so the modified old deprecated field with the additional singleton bindings doesn't get copied over to the new property. There doesn't seem to be a way to reliably detect this situation.

* Fixed flags not being copied in Clone methods and fixed so a Guid is generated for actions in constructor

- When adding a serialized InputAction (or with an InputActionProperty), the ID Guid may not be generated, which could cause noise in prefab overrides. Having the constructor generate an ID initially instead of relying on the id property or property drawer generate one and write to the asset makes it more consistent. This specifically fixes the GameObject > XR > XR Origin (VR) creation shortcut not having IDs set since the Inspector is never visible before making a prefab.

* Fixed changelog after merge of 1.6.2 release

* Fixed changelog to put new stuff in Unreleased section, not 1.6.2

* Added property getter for the fields instead of making the fields internal

- We can potentially make the new properties public and even add setters along with a property for useReference, but this way of keeping them internal will avoid having to bump minor version to fix this bug.

author: Joo
message:
NEW: Allow selection of InputActionReferences from project-wide actions (#1779)

* Add InputActionReference advanced picker

This new picker allows us to search InputActionReferences from the project wide actions asset. Since this is asset is in ProjectSettings, a normal object picker doesn't work.

* Update InputActionReferences of project-wide actions on save

* Check for dangling action references in Inspector and set them to "None"

A dangling action reference means a actin reference that point to a non-existent InputAction.
This needs to be checked here in case an input action is removed from the project-wide actions asset. Otherwise the UI will still hold on to a dangling action reference.

* Remove unused code

* Fix comments references

* Correct variables naming

* Test updating references when asset actions are changed

* Only check dangling project-wide action references

* Update CHANGELOG

* Make InputActionAssetIconLoader methods internal

* Make advanced picker open by default with list view and simple search query

OpenInBuilder mode allows to search by "tags". But no implementation was done so they did not work.

* Run added tests only on the Editor

author: Chris Massie
message:
FIX: GetHapticCapabilitiesCommand always failing to execute (#1776)

* Fixed GetHapticCapabilitiesCommand always failing to execute and added missing haptic capabilities properties

* Added setter to make migration better if the user was setting the old field

* Fixed API_MinorVersionsHaveNoBreakingChanges by reverting renames

The names won't match the UnityEngine.XR and IUnityXRInput.h names, but this is needed to avoid a breaking change. Renamed the optimal size field to more closely match the naming of maxBufferSize for consistency within Input System.

* Reverted redundant explicit field initialization since it was causing API_MinorVersionsHaveNoBreakingChanges to fail. The value remains the same.

The test could be updated in the future to recognize the value is the same, but for now it's easier to just revert the change.

* Added xml-doc to public fields and methods

---------

Co-authored-by: James McGill <jamesmcgill@users.noreply.github.com>

author: Hkan Sidenvall
message:
CHANGE: Switch from InputManager.asset to asset-based storage for Project-wide actions (#1834)

* Replacing use of Inputmanager.asset with promoted InputActionsAsset
** Old settings in: ProjectSettings\InputManager.asset
** New settings in: Assets\InputSystem_Actions.inputactions
* Improved UX for the project wide input actions in project settings
* Added indication of selected project wide input actions asset
* Fixed up some styles for the header
* Fixed Editor_LeavingPlayMode_DestroysAllActionStates test for when InputSystem.actions is null
* Sanity checks added to project wide input actions
* Removed redundant code for saving InputActionAssets and relocated to InputActionAssetManager. Eliminated redundant dialog strings by utilising a common utility function regardless of editor framework.
* Reset behavior is an in-memory operation that is undoable.
* Added clear menu option to quickly clean up default asset if desirable. Modified CopyPasteHelpers, SerializationHelpers to allow using buffer modification for any string buffer.
* Moved access to physical path to helper to avoid #ifdef in code.
* Code added to migrate InputSystem's project-wide action assets from InputManager asset
** Only try to migrate project-wide input action assets from InputManager.asset file once.
* Updated InputActionAsset and InputActionReference property drawers
**Project wide input action assets now shown in separate column in InputActionAsset view like the InputActionReference view.
**Removed the dropdown to select between at the top level since that's not so intuitive when the project wide asset reference can change.
* Removed a fix for ISX-1721 which is having a side effect of limiting nesting in hierarchy
* Project Settings Input Action Edito handles deleting assets while being open. Reenabled and updated and added some unit tests for related asset management.
* Added confirmation box on creating an new asset that would overwrite an existing
* Made sure project wide input actions are enabled on entering play mode
* Disable project wide input actions on exit play mode (well enter edit mode)
* Temporarily disabled ProjectWideActions_ThrowsWhenAddingOrRemovingWhileEnabled test since unclear of its relevance.
* Corrected improper use of operator for null checks when using UnityEngine.Object
* InputForUI hook added to update when InputSystem.actions changes
* Removed one test which is causing next two to fail
* Gracefully disable actions to avoid assert on destruction

author: Hkan Sidenvall
message:
FIX: ISX-1890 Fixed issues where Input Action Asset editors would not react properly to assets being deleted, moved or renamed with editor open (#1850)

* FIX: Fixed modification and post processors to handle assets in .inputactions editors as well as work on instance working copy.

* FIX: Fixed a regression in IMGUI editor where it would auto-save on focus lost even with toggle disabled.

* FIX: Added mocking support for all Input System user dialogs and default mocking and restore of dialogs as part of InputTestFixture

* FIX: Assets now properly respond to and update working copy of serializedobject with preserved selection indices.

* FIX: Removed hard-coded coupling between importer and editor. Removed redundant code in IMGUI editor which is handled via common processor callbacks.

* FIX: Adressed an issue where lack of index to GUID and GUID to index transformations could lead to invalid selections when switching serializedObject instances in editor.

* FIX: Desubscribe from state change callbacks in case object destroy or GC is delayed. Fixed UITK editor not showing correct state after a domain reload with editor open. Simplified editor window code. Improved exception safety in editor window to be more robust and close window in case of fatal exception.

* ADD: Added test utility AssetDatabaseUtils.cs.

author: Hkan Sidenvall
message:
CHANGE: ISX-1901, ISX-1520: Project-wide actions assignment only assignable in edit-mode (#1866)

* FIX: Removed explicit enable of project-wide actions from example. This should be guaranteed by API contract of InputSystem.actions.

* FIX: Disabled dialogs in tests. Added proper play-mode and player test suites for Project wide actions which required some refactoring. Renamed InputTestFixture.Setup to SetUp to not collide with UTF framework interfaces.

* FIX: Fixed ProjectWideInputActionsEditorTests so that it doesn't have side-effects on users configuration of InputSystem.actions or Asset folder files.

* FIX: Fixed incorrect test case assuming project-wide actions would be enabled in edit mode. Now correctly compensate after entering play mode for the specific scenario.

* FIX: Adjustments to existing test cases for edit-mode, editor play-mode, player play-mode and additional tests.

* FIX: Updated InputForUITests to work with preloaded asset. Updated CoreTests_ProjectWideActions to utilise editor build settings to preserve user configuration.

* FIX: Removed an assert that would generate an error in builds. Instead check if asset to be included as preloaded asset is null and skip including it if that is the case.

* FIX: Disallow reassigning InputSystem.actions in editor during play-mode to prevent exception from being thrown when attempting to do so.

---------

Co-authored-by: Alex Tyrer <alextyrer@unity3d.com>
Co-authored-by: Paulius Dervinis <54306142+Pauliusd01@users.noreply.github.com>

author: Ben Pitt
message:
Docs UI support improvements (#1916)

author: Joo Freire
message:
FIX: The button is not clickable when using Windows touch simulation inputs (ISXB-483) (#2012)

* Pair simulated touchscreen with PlayerInput user

* Add period to end of sentence

* Fix formatting

* Refactored initial fix to queue state events instead

Based on review and code comments, this seems like a better solution that fixes the main problem and also better simulates a touchscreen when used together with PlayerInput.
Automatic pairing and control scheme occurs now since we're using input events a real device would also use.

* Change logic to be based on state events

The previous logic was based on changing state and didn't apply if we queued events.

Also, this commit avoids processing the queued events for the simulated Touchscreen.

* Remove unnecessary left over code

* Fix setting wrong touchIDs when moving multiple touches

author: Alex Tyrer
message:
FIX: The "Add Control Scheme..." popup now requires explicit Save/Close user action (case ISXB-1131) (#2044)

* [Input System] The "Add Control Scheme..." popup now requires explicit Save/Close user action (case ISXB-1131)

o Previously clicking outside the popup window (anywhere in the editor) would close the popup window.

o This would leave a new blank (unnamed, orphaned) control scheme populating the UI - this was confusing.

o Now this popup will persist until the user explictly chooses to Save or Cancel.

* [Input System] Added CHANGELOG entry for "Add Control Scheme..." popup fix (case ISXB-1131)

* [Input System] Fix typo in CHANGELOG entry - removed extraneous final closing parenthesis.

* [Input System] Licensing failure - try limiting to version 2021.3.45f

author: Tim Aidley
message:
Change ffmpeg instructions.

The (now defunct) ffmpeg library url has been removed and some scripts
added that will automatically build an h264-only version of ffmpeg.

The .ps1 script makes a temporary local cygwin install with all required
dependences, and then uses it to run the .sh script, which fetches the
x264 and ffmpeg source, and builds from it. The ps1 script installs the
exe and licenses afterwards, and removes all the build data.

.gitattributes is also amended so as to preserve the UNIX line endings
for the .sh script.

author: Mike Miller
message:
Add CI Builds to PRs and pushes to main (#43)

* Build Android/Oculus, Win64/Monoscopic, Win64/SteamVR
* Install Oculus v23.1 unitypackage
* Install TMP Essential Resources from v2.0.1
* Add and ignore (mandatory) option -buildVersion
* Add and ignore (mandatory) option -android*
* Rename Tiltasaurus.json to tiltasaurus.json to match the filename in
  both the .cs and .py files
* Accept -customBuildPath as an alternative to -btb-out
* Pass -btb-out explicitly (TODO; why can't we use -customBuildPath)
* Add code to replace InitializeOnLoad (not called in CI)
* Explicitly call OVRPluginUpdater prior to build (normally done in the editor)
* Add -setDefaultPlatformTextureFormat astc for Android builds
* Add -btb-github to change Display Name and App Identifier to contain
  'github' to not conflict with the official OpenBrush apk
* Add StandaloneOSX

Note that after downloading, run:

xattr -d com.apple.quarantine ~/Downloads/StandaloneOSX-*/OpenBrush-github.app

(or open from the GUI with a right-click -> Open).

This is to avoid the warnings about unsigned code.

* Shorten some long lines
* Add the github SHA to the build stamp
* Use hardcoded license

author: Mike Miller
message:
Name builds based on the source (#117)

In order to make it easier to run multiple versions, instead of a fixed
"-github" name (and package name of com.icosa.openbrushgithub), this
commit changes the logic for CI builds.

* Builds from PRs are named PR#xx (PRxx in the package name)
* Builds from branches (triggered with a [CI BUILD] tag) are named based on the branch
name. Special characters of /[#_-]/ are removed from the package name
* All commits on main have the same name, whether they're pre-release
builds or formal release builds. This means that the pre-release builds
will NOT have a unique name, but this will allow us to upload them to a
"beta" release channel

author: Mike Miller
message:
Fix dotnet format in CI (and possibly locally) (#338)

* Fix dotnet-format in pre-commit

.NET has moved to 7.x, and with it, pre-commit no longer installs
dotnet-format properly. It gives this error:

    [INFO] Initializing environment for https://github.com/dotnet/format.
    [INFO] Installing environment for https://github.com/dotnet/format.
    [INFO] Once installed this environment will be reused.
    [INFO] This may take a few minutes...
    An unexpected error has occurred: CalledProcessError: command: ('/usr/local/bin/dotnet', 'tool', 'install', '--tool-path', '/Users/FOO/.cache/pre-commit/repoXXXXXXXX/dotnetenv-default/bin', '--add-source', 'pre-commit-build', 'dotnet-format')
    return code: 1
    expected return code: 0
    stdout:
	/var/folders/0b/mq_jkw6n6x75xr18vy44lmb40000gn/T/ab063401-9d0d-4610-a73d-6db1b84c23b8/restore.csproj : error NU1100: Unable to resolve 'dotnet-format (>= 0.0.0)' for 'net7.0'. PackageSourceMapping is enabled, the following source(s) were not considered: /Users/FOO/.cache/pre-commit/repoXXXXXXXX/pre-commit-build, dotnet-eng, dotnet-libraries, dotnet-public, dotnet-tools, dotnet7.
	/var/folders/0b/mq_jkw6n6x75xr18vy44lmb40000gn/T/ab063401-9d0d-4610-a73d-6db1b84c23b8/restore.csproj : error NU1100: Unable to resolve 'dotnet-format (>= 0.0.0)' for 'net7.0/any'. PackageSourceMapping is enabled, the following source(s) were not considered: /Users/FOO/.cache/pre-commit/repoXXXXXXXX/pre-commit-build, dotnet-eng, dotnet-libraries, dotnet-public, dotnet-tools, dotnet7.

    stderr:
	The tool package could not be restored.
	Tool 'dotnet-format' failed to install. This failure may have been caused by:

	* You are attempting to install a preview release and did not use the --version option to specify the version.
	* A package by this name was found, but it was not a .NET tool.
	* The required NuGet feed cannot be accessed, perhaps because of an Internet connection problem.
	* You mistyped the name of the tool.

	For more reasons, including package naming enforcement, visit https://aka.ms/failure-installing-tool

By resurrecting the hack from #166, we can install dotnet format
directly, manually.

I don't know what causes this, but at least it's documented for the next
time!

* dotnet-format new whitespaces changes

message:
Mesh splitting (#880)

* initial implementation

* Handle Blocks objs from Icosa

* set m_LastThumbnail_SS to a sane value for JSON sketch export

* Set cameraPose  in newglb exports

* Set valid before running material collector

* GLTF extras should be serialized as strings for backwards compat

* Catch a potential exception that breaks multiplayer stroke sending

* Move non-vr ui into prefab and disable fly tool initially so it's UI doesn't appear onscreen

* Handle all extensions (currently unused path)

* Stop sorting sketches client side

* Default to new obj loader unless overridden

* Try this way round of operations

* Update UnityGLTF

* auto-formatting change

This reverts commit 0b1341c04b82add5df0491afeee8e2fbb7f2d827.

* Pin UnityGLTF version to a specific release

* Missed an obvious reason to hit this branch. Update comment accordingly

* We should match formats based on preference rather than just grabbing the first one we find

* Don't use new loader for local objs

* "Fix" a long term irritating startup error

* Fixes a bunch of console warnings

* This change belongs with "Don't use new loader for local objs" 170ce9 but I forgot to include it

* Stop useless network calls to tiltbrush.com

* Avoid a harmless error when stopping the scene in the editor

* Remove canvas renderer to avoid warning log

* Remove dup or unused imports

* Unused imports

* The sketch model precaching seems to be causing issues and might not be needed

* Add a comment and commented out AssignMaterialsToCollector for future reference

* Switch to async obj loading

* I'll take "things that change by themselves for no reason" for 10, Alex.

* Swap handling of MTL d and tr (I had mixed up which should be the inverse of the other)

* We were double creating obj geometry so put some more guardrails in place

* Define the main colours and textures to help with export in UnityGLTF

* ensure we are running the material collector on import

* Support "break apart" for all formats

* Some error logging that I will hopefully be able to find in logcat

* Rename a "poly" reference I missed before

* Disable stylus code due to huge amounts of log noise

* Erroneous import

* rename EnablePolyPreload to Icosa

* Add a TODO

* Partly working

(just have to fix loading from a save and detecting when a mesh is already split)

* Check if a mesh has already been split and prevent further attempts

* support split meshes in save/load

* Restore Logitech stylus support that was disabled during debugging

* Catch some nulls

* Small optimization

* Record unsplittable meshes to save processing when loading a sketch. Fix some logic bugs

* Handle an edge case

* Adjust tiltmeter cost after syncing the hierarchy

* Time to increase Quest memory warning limits (approx. doubling them)

* Require confirmation for mesh splits. Clean up logic around checking if splitting is possible

* Only assert outside the editor as it was creating a lot of log spam

* Untangle the logic around what can be ungrouped

* tidy up the UI for split mesh confirmation

* only ask for confirmation if a single node is selected for splitting

* don't throw an exception if no widgets are selected

* Add confirm popup to mobile advanced tools panel also

author: Matt Schoen
message:
Fix bugs that came up during release testing:
- Fix snapping menu not being interactable by disabling settings menu face while submenus are open; Fix off-by-one error in disabling the last subMenu
- Fix NullReferenceExceptions in spatial menu related to FI by using InjectFunctionalitySingle instead of ConnectInterfaces on SpatialMenuElements
- Fix an issue where user position was not being saved due to EditorXRViewerModule clearing state before serializing preferences; Removed properties which cached the state of `preserveLayout` to prevent this issue, and set shutdownOrder for EditorXRViewerModule to be later than SerializedPreferencesModule
- Move RayInputModule out of UnityEngine namespace to fix stack traces; Add namespaces to classes that were missing them
- Fix NullReferenceExceptions in IntersectionUtils by checking for null mesh
files_changed: CHANGELOG.md; LockableHierarchyGUI.cs; PolyToolkitHelper.cs; MainMenuFace.cs; MainMenuUI.cs; SpatialMenuUI.cs; EditorXRViewerModule.cs; IInspectorWorkspace.cs; RayInputModule.cs; IUsesRayOrigins.cs; WorkspaceModule.cs; IntersectionUtils.cs; package.json

author: Nicholas Benson
message:
Port Drawing namespace Sim-compatibility changes -> UnityPlugin

This commit moves the "Drawer" from the main Leap.Unity namespace to a new Leap.Unity.Drawing namespace. Drawer is only used in a handful of places in the plugin, and it's a very generic name, so importers of the Leap.Unity SDK shouldn't have that name conflict with one of their own classes.

This is a significant simplification for a number of files in the Simulator codebase, which is a consumer of the SDK's Leap.Unity namespace and, indeed, has its own Drawer class.

This commit also removes a handful of unused imports from the files it touches.

author: Robert Blenkinsopp
message:
Remove custom UNITY_2021_3_18_OR_NEWER define

Now we don't officially support 2021 as its out of LTS, we can remove a lot of ifdefs for older versions of the code which we don't need to support any more. This also eases Unity 6 compatibility by avoiding complex ifdef trees for some common code.

author: Enrique Tromp
message:
Multiple bugfixes and improvements

### Added

- Add IUxrGrabbableModifier interface to create components that control certain parts
  of an UxrGrabbableObject. The UxrGrabbableObject inspector automatically disables the
  controlled UI sections and has also capability to show/hide the controlled parameters.
  The goal is to provide a scalable way to extend grabbable functionality by adding
  modifier components to the object.
- Add Reset() and OnValidate() to the overridable Unity methods in UxrComponent.
- Add ConstraintsFinished to UxrGrabbableObject to create logic after custom constraints
  have been applied.
- Add constants to UxrGrabbableObjectEditor for UxrGrabbableObject field names.
- Add "Any" variations to GetButtonsPress/GetButtonsTouch when multiple buttons are
  specified so that any button in the set is enough to meet the criteria instead of all.
- Add EnumExt for Enum extensions.
- Add static events to UxrControllerInput to receive events whenever any controller
  sends input data.

### Changed

- Change UxrApplyConstraintsEventArgs to contain the UxrGrabber instead of UxrGrabbableObject.
  The UxrGrabbableObject can still be accessed using the GrabbedObject property from
  the grabber.
- Use ConstraintsFinished in UxrManipulationHapticFeedback in order to process object
  after custom constraints have been applied.
- Rename UxrLocomotionTeleportBaseEditor to UxrTeleportLocomotionBaseEditor.
- Update example scene prefabs so that they show the cyborg grab poses by default.

### Fixed

- Fix joystick directional buttons (left/right/up/down) when getting ignored input.
- Fix bug in UxrGrabbableObjectEditor that under some circumstances throws exceptions
  when previewing grab poses.
- Fix UxrGrabbableObject constrained rotation on a single axis not working correctly when
  parent has different axes.
- Fix UxrTeleportSpawnCollider not raising Teleported event.

author: Enrique Tromp
message:
Add manipulation improvements and fixes

- Add MinSingleRotationDegrees/MaxSingleRotationDegrees to UxrGrabbableObject when constrained to a single degree of freedom.
- Fix bug in UxrGrabManager that prevents GrabToggle manipulation mode to place objects on anchors.
- Fix UxrGrabbableObject manipulation not working correctly when grab points are moved around during grabbing, for example when applying constraints.
- Fix bug in UxrGrabbableObject.SetGrabPointEnabled not working correctly.
- Fix UxrGrabPointShapes not computing center of grab correctly in some cases.

message:
Quest Compatibility Update

-Added toggle to disable depth light requirements for VRSL shaders on a per scene basis for Quest compatibility
-Added toggle to remove 2D and 3D noise effects from volumetric shaders to reduce their overhead on quest.
-Implmented many toggles as keywords for static branching instead of dynamic branching to improve performance slightly.
-Slight performance improvement on volumetric shaders.
-Fixed 3D noise time bug
