author: Ezra Hill
message:
Added Snap Turning (#556)

* Added Snap Turning

- Disabled by default, can be enabled in settings
- Amount per input can be defined in settings (current range is 15 - 90 degrees)
- Default input action is the right thumb stick (same as smooth turn)

* Moved snap turn from slider to selector for settings

* Fixed snap turning with smooth HUD/Helmet

- Previously, the smooth HUD/Helmet would uncomfortably move a long distance after you snap turn
- Now, if smooth HUD and snap turning are both enabled, the helmet snap turns for a frame, then resumes it's previous behavior

* Disable snap turning while in zero-g

---------

Co-authored-by: Raicuparta <Raicuparta@users.noreply.github.com>
files_changed: IModSettingProvider.cs; ModSettings.cs; OWMLSettingsProvider.cs; default-config.json; PlayerBodyPosition.cs; HelmetFollowCameraRotation.cs

author: Lawrence Wong
message:
Fix crashes when clicking dropdown UI

This happens only on Unity 5.6. Don't know why the content in the
scroll view have the NaN rect value and causes editor to crash. So
current solution to work around is to remove the scroll view in the
dropdown UI.

Resolves: #12

author: Lawrence Wong
message:
Remove bind all button

It is recommended that only binding device to TrackerRole or BodyRole. It
is not recommended to bind DeviceRole or HandRole, should leave their
auto-mappings for general usage. For other speicial cases, it's better to
create new ViveRole manually.

author: lawwong
message:
Add Simulator and new VIUSettings

* Add new options in Edit -> Preferences... -> VIU Settings
  - Contains more options to control VIU behaviour at runtime
    - Enable Binding Interface Switch
    - Enable External Camera Switch
    - Support Simulated Device
    - Support Vive Device (OpenVR compatible device)
    - Support Oculus Device
  - Option changes in editor mode are saved into VIUSettings.asset file, and loaded from the file at runtime
    - Default asset file path is at Assets/HTC.UnityPlugin/ViveInputUtility/Resources/VIUSettings.asset.
    - The asset file don't have to be exist, will read default settings if asset file not found.
    - Use VIUSettings.LoadFromResource(path) to load settings from alternative location.

* Add VR Device Simulator
  - Simulator VR Module is activated when no VR device detected (no other VR Modules are available).
  - Simulator can simulate spawn/remove fake device, tracking, input events.
  - There are 2 ways to manipulate the fake devices
    - Handle events by script manually
      - HTC.UnityPlugin.VRModuleManagement.VRModule.Simulator.onUpdateDeviceState
        - Invoked each frame when VRModule performs a device state update
        - Write device state into currState argument to manipulate devices
        - Read-only argument prefState preserved device state in last frame
    - Use built-in Keyboard-Mouse control (can be disabled in HTC.UnityPlugin.Vive.VIUSettings.enableSimulatorKeyboardMouseControl)
      - Add/Remove/Select devices
        - [0~9] Add and select device N if device N is not selected, otherwise, deselect it
        - [` + 0~5] Add and select device 10+N if device 10+N is not selected, otherwise, deselect it
        - [Shift + 0~9] Remove and deselect device N
        - [Shift + ` + 0~5] Remove and deselect device 10+N
      - Control selected device
        - [W] Move selected device forward
        - [S] Move selected device backward
        - [D] Move selected device right
        - [A] Move selected device left
        - [E] Move selected device up
        - [Q] Move selected device down
        - [C] Roll+ selected device
        - [Z] Roll- selected device
        - [X] Reset selected device roll
        - [ArrowUp] Pitch+ selected device
        - [ArrowDown] Pitch- selected device
        - [ArrowRight] Yaw+ selected device
        - [ArrowLeft] Yaw- selected device
        - [MouseMove] Pitch/Yaw selected device
        - [MouseLeft] Press Trigger on selected device
        - [MouseRight] Press Trackpad on selected device
        - [MouseMiddle] Press Grip on selected device
        - [Hold Shift + MouseMove] Touch Trackpad on selected device
      - Control HMD
        - [T] Move hmd forward
        - [G] Move hmd backward
        - [H] Move hmd right
        - [F] Move hmd left
        - [Y] Move hmd up
        - [R] Move hmd down
        - [N] Roll+ hmd
        - [V] Roll- hmd
        - [B] Reset hmd roll
        - [I] Pitch+ hmd
        - [K] Pitch- hmd
        - [L] Yaw+ hmd
        - [J] Yaw- hmd

* Define symbol VIU_BINDING_INTERFACE_SWITCH & VIU_EXTERNAL_CAMERA_SWITCH no longer used
  - Is replaced by VIUSettins.enableBindingInterfaceSwitch and VIUSettings.enableExternalCameraSwitch
  - Changing the setting no longer need re-compile

* Re-organize Component Menu

author: lawwong
message:
Add Daydream support (experimental)

* New features
  - Add GoogleVRModule to support Daydream View and Controller (experimental)
    - Required environment to build Daydream project
      - Android SDK is installed on your OS
      - Java SDK is installed on your OS
      - Use Unity 5.6 or later version to open your project
      - Import GoogleVRForUnity (1.110.0 or later) to your project
      - In your project, make sure Edit->Preference->VIUSettings->Daydream check-box is checked

* Bug fix
  - Now VIU is compatable with both SteamVR Plugin v1.2.2 and v1.2.3
  - Now recommended setting for "Show Unity Splash Screen" works correctly

* Improvement
  - Now ignore recommneded setting keys will be stored in project asset file, instead of UnityEditor.EditorPrefs
    - Default path is Assets\HTC.UnityPlugin\ViveInputUtility\Scripts\Editor\VIUProjectSettings.asset
  - Remove unused components/scripts in example 7

message:
Make scroll delta tunable from the Editor

Made the hard-coded scroll delta in Update() a member of the class so it can be easily modified from the Editor. Large, far away objects need to have the delta tuned so they can be easily moved without having to scroll too much. The default value of 0.01f has been preserved.

author: lawwong
message:
Simplify SteamVRSkeletonSetting to SteamVRSkeletonMode

This settings also effect SteamVRModule.RenderModelCreator
SteamVRSkeletonMode.Disabled:
  Show controller only
SteamVRSkeletonMode.WithController:
  Show controller and rigged hand
SteamVRSkeletonMode.WithoutController:
  Show rigged hand only

  Notice that changing VIUSettings.steamVRLeftSkeletonMode in play mode
won't effect RenderModel immediatly, now you have to disable & enable
RenderModelHook after changing skeleton mode.

author: DaXcess
message:
Bunch of bugfixes
- Removed verbose logging in Actions.cs
- (Hopefully) fixed an issue where timings could cause players to be muffled indefinitely
- Fixed centipede not dropping for any player if the host is dead (and has the mod)
- (Hopefully) fixed little girl not un-targeting the host if they die
- Fixed teleporter teleporting the spectator ghost player if they have no body
- Disabled debug menu in Release builds
- Fixed some mods causing the teleporter timer to be below 0
- Changed a tiny bit of locomotion code, potentially fixing a slight but barely noticeable jitter when walking

author: Mathias Lefebre
message:
Implemented BasisUIReparenter and attached it to HamBurgerMenu and SettingsUI

The BasisUIReparenter reparents the UI object to which it's attached to the LocalPlayer if the player moves too far away from the UI.
This solves the issue where the UI becomes unusable if the player falls infinitely or is involuntarily moving in some other way.

While it might be preferable to make the distance a global setting instead of configuring it per script, I've opted not to implement that for now to avoid cluttering the settings UI.

author: Ha~
message:
Simplify avatar setup:
- Avatar can now be tested without the Initialization scene. Most initialization code has been moved to OnAvatarReady, as OnAvatarNetworkReady was only needed to bind the wearer ID for the networking of packets.
- AvatarComms is added to the avatar when it loads.
- AcquisitionService is added to the scene when the avatar loads.
- AcquisitionService and OSCAcquisitionServer are now DontDestroyOnLoad.
- It is no longer required to manually wire the BasisAvatar, FeatureNetworking, and Acquisition.
- FeatureNetworking will now search for the first networkable component if it is given a Transform component. This makes it easier to drag and drop a networkable component.
- When the BlendshapeActuation component is disabled, the blendshape values are set back to zero.
- BlendshapeActuation no longer unregisters OnDisable, it does it on OnDestroy instead, because the registration of events happens when the avatar is ready.

author: MidnightWaffles
message:
Add DNS Resolve

This code will select IPv4 if it can find it in the DNS response.

I strongly urge that we move to IPv6 based on modern day hosting costs. But for now this will select the first IPv4 that the hostname resolves to.

author: Ha~
message:
Work towards adding Toggles, and Face Tracking fixes:
- Work towards adding Toggles:
  - Add Object State Actuation component.
  - Toggling from OFF to ON sends a packet.
  - Toggling from ON to OFF sends a packet.
  - Late joining / Late loading: When a remote player loads the avatar, it asks the avatar wearer to send the state of the toggle to them.
  - Early loading: If a remote player loads the avatar faster than the wearer, the wearer will send the state of the toggle when the wearer finishes loading.
  - Unlike face tracking, this is not a continuous stream of data, so no packets are sent continuously if the toggle remains untouched.
- Improve late loading and early loading in the HVRAvatarComms protocol:
  - When a non-wearer finishes loading the avatar networking, a Reserved packet of type "Remote Requests Initialization" is sent to the wearer, so that the wearer sends a Negotiation packet to them.
  - When the wearer finishes loading the avatar networking, a Negotiation packet is sent to everyone else.
  - Remove periodic Negotiation packet, which was a hack for which the aforementioned changes replace.
- Null values are removed from user-provided arrays (i.e. in BlendshapeActuation).
- Support resyncing in features:
  - When after a Negotiation packet is sent, the wearer also asks the features to submit packets for resyncing state.
- AcquisitionAssist can now feed data with values 0 and 1, presented as buttons to test toggles.
- Face Tracking fixes:
  - Blendshape Actuation is now less sensitive to execution order of OnAvatarReady and OnAvatarNetworkReady, as the order appears to be currently different if the avatar is local or remote.
  - Fix data Acquisition was incorrectly feeding data for remote objects.
  - Eye Tracking Bone Actuation is now a ICommsNetworkable component, as eye bones are no longer networked in Basis. This requires a reupload of avatars, since this component now needs to be registered with a GUID in Feature Networking.
  - Fix Eye Tracking now fetches the eye bone driver of both the local player and remote players, instead of just the local player.
  - Fix execution order is now specified to run after other bone drivers that was interfering with the bone rotation.
  - Add a hack so that eye lids aren't closed by default. We need to add default values in the blendshape definition files.

author: itsKat
message:
Camera updates (#245)

* UI Updates

You can now close the Camera. - Sorry!
Moved FOV Slider to be more ergonomic.

* Optimizing how the Camera works

Centralized UI Panel Toggling
- Introduced a ToggleOnlyThisPanel() method with a for loop and array of all option panels.
- Reduces unnecessary SetActive(false) calls and layout rebuilds.

UI LayerMask Caching
- Cached uiLayerMask once during Awake(), removing repeated calls to LayerMask.NameToLayer("UI").
- Improves performance and ensures consistency.

Optimized RenderTexture Allocation
- SetResolution() now reuses the existing renderTexture if dimensions and format havent changed.
- Prevents expensive reallocation and garbage collection.

Texture2D Pooling
- Added EnsureTexturePool() to reuse a single Texture2D for screenshots.
- Reduces allocations and memory churn per frame.

Fill RenderTexture with GPU-Accelerated Clear
- Replaced manual GL-based color fill with Graphics.Blit and a reusable Unlit/Color shader material.
- Offloads to GPU and simplifies logic.

Combined WaitForEndOfFrame Calls
- Consolidated two yield return new WaitForEndOfFrame() calls into one in TakeScreenshot.
- Ensures all operations happen in one frame and reduces latency.

author: itsKat
message:
Camera updates (#246)

* UI Updates

You can now close the Camera. - Sorry!
Moved FOV Slider to be more ergonomic.

* Optimizing how the Camera works

Centralized UI Panel Toggling
- Introduced a ToggleOnlyThisPanel() method with a for loop and array of all option panels.
- Reduces unnecessary SetActive(false) calls and layout rebuilds.

UI LayerMask Caching
- Cached uiLayerMask once during Awake(), removing repeated calls to LayerMask.NameToLayer("UI").
- Improves performance and ensures consistency.

Optimized RenderTexture Allocation
- SetResolution() now reuses the existing renderTexture if dimensions and format havent changed.
- Prevents expensive reallocation and garbage collection.

Texture2D Pooling
- Added EnsureTexturePool() to reuse a single Texture2D for screenshots.
- Reduces allocations and memory churn per frame.

Fill RenderTexture with GPU-Accelerated Clear
- Replaced manual GL-based color fill with Graphics.Blit and a reusable Unlit/Color shader material.
- Offloads to GPU and simplifies logic.

Combined WaitForEndOfFrame Calls
- Consolidated two yield return new WaitForEndOfFrame() calls into one in TakeScreenshot.
- Ensures all operations happen in one frame and reduces latency.

* Camera Preview & UI

Fixing the FOV Slider from being Hidden when toggling between sub-menus

Added a "Framerate Limiter" for the Image Preview, it will now use Half Framerate, rounded to 5.

* "Yuge" Camera Updates

Oh boy where do I start...

Reworked most of the UI/UX Components.
Removed all unused buttons, and replaced the most useful ones with Toggles.

PNG/EXR Toggle
Resolution 4 Stage Toggle

Added Features:
- DOF Auto
- DOF Manual
- DOF Cursor (Allowing the user to click on the screen where they'd like the DOF distance to be set
- Exposure Stops at (0.5) intervals from -3 to +3

Added Sprites:
- Cursor
- Exposure
- Nameplate2_CameraButton (a rework of version 1)
- PNG/EXR
- Resolution

Updated:
BasisUIRaycastProcess
- You only try to access [0] when the lists are not empty
- Prevents errors due to an empty raycast list
Assumptions are now Guarded! Hopefully?

New scripting logic:
PreviewClickDirect.cs
- This is the helper script for the Raycasting to determine where the user is attempting to set the DOF Distance via Cursor.

* Code Readability Refactor for Camera

Cleaned up the Initialize function
Cached Post Processing Refs

SaveSettings, ApplySettings, LoadSettings updated to reflect readability changes

Fixed Australian Typo in BasisHandHeldCamera.cs :)

When spawning a camera, it now checks if there are any other cameras, destroys said other camera and spawns a new one.

SaveSettings automatically applies during Camera Close, so when you open it, you have your settings! Yippie.

Unused Junk removal in code.

* Camera Logging - and null checks

BasisHandHeldCamera.cs:
private const reporting for duty

BASIS debug, i tried adding debugs :')

no configureawait

null checking for hit.collider, sorry, first implementation

BasisHandHeldCameraUI.cs:
Bounds checking & less repeated .length

Less errors in ApplySettings

PreviewClickDirect.cs: (Awful naming scheme)
Better debugging, sorry dooly!

BasisHamburgerMenu.cs:
Added a warning for attempting to destroy nothing

* Camera now identifies as Asynchronous

Added:
private const float RaycastMaxDistance = 1000f;
instead of creating a magic number inside the raycast.

HandHeld.SaveSettings is now async

* Camera & Personal Mirrors

Nothing like pulling your hair out!

But hey, a personal mirror :)

---------

Co-authored-by: dooly <doolanl208@gmail.com>

author: Techanon
message:
User Input Control Improvements (#258)

* Change crouch input action from value to button.
Add gamepad run action via left stick press.
Move LookAction value reading from input event to Update loop for more responsive input speed.
Add tap/hold specific interactions for handling dynamic crouch.
Add guard for input lock when application is closing to avoid unecessary error logging.
Add adjustable crouch.
Update animator driver to have a configurable threshold for what it considers to be crouched for handling dynamic crouch.
Update avatar eye input to use the dynamic crouch value.
Add contextual locking mechanism and update input blocks to utilize it.
Fix typo in gitignore comment.
Fix a couple initialize methods with typos.
Reorganize configuration variables for movement/crouch to handle dynamic crouch seamlessly.
Add external-read-only properties to enable auditing of the runtime data.
Add methods for explicitly managing the movement speed and crouch amount.
Partial progress towards a consistent API structure for initialization ordering.

* Move animator driver Initialize method towards top of the class.
Remove head pause/unpause methods in favor of direct use of BasisLocks.
Remove the Update method for LocalInputActions in favor of better input event implementation logic.
Remove redundant OnMenu action, it's entirely unnecessary.

* Update any implicit transform reference to use 'this.' prefix.

* update prefab saved data.

* Switch ui enter action to find next selectable instead of just deselect.

* fixed used name

---------

Co-authored-by: dooly <doolanl208@gmail.com>

author: dooly
message:
fixed full body null ref (#299)

* improved server performance by a little

* connecting will now do it after success to reduce network load

* doolysbranch_camera_update_4

Added ability to view RenderTexture // Camera View on desktop for recording

* updated default avatar, faster methods added, should no longer crash from excessive waiting data

* ready to test out in the wild

* latest server version

* fixed editor script, pointing to jinxy server for todays test

* swapped to server2

* added unsafe functions for decompression and removed simplified and correction execution order of basis networking components

* ready to test properly

* individual player settings is now more performant and uses a snap value

* added crash report button to find it on disc, added option to enable disable console on server

* Adds a prebuild bundle event list for locking shadurs

Waits for all tasks to finish before building

* cleaned up ready to merge

* ownership changed to OnOwnershipReleased

* console task swapped for thread needs validation, removed offset (multithread count issue fixed)

* improved ownership, removed some unused memory from NetworkReceiver, updated host mode

* added a muscle range class, fixed a steam audio bug

* admin panel updated

* updated HasSentOnLocalPlayerJoin  to LocalPlayerIsConnected

* added way to traverse to net id / basis scene

* camera ui updates

Fixed UI Bugs
Added DOF Enable/Disable toggle
Made camera thinner
Added new textures

Lots of Button code :)

* improved nameplate rendering performance once again

should also lower slightly impact of a player joining

* cleaned up some of the remote nameplate code

* turned on culling for text on nameplate

* Camera updates (#245)

* UI Updates

You can now close the Camera. - Sorry!
Moved FOV Slider to be more ergonomic.

* Optimizing how the Camera works

Centralized UI Panel Toggling
- Introduced a ToggleOnlyThisPanel() method with a for loop and array of all option panels.
- Reduces unnecessary SetActive(false) calls and layout rebuilds.

UI LayerMask Caching
- Cached uiLayerMask once during Awake(), removing repeated calls to LayerMask.NameToLayer("UI").
- Improves performance and ensures consistency.

Optimized RenderTexture Allocation
- SetResolution() now reuses the existing renderTexture if dimensions and format havent changed.
- Prevents expensive reallocation and garbage collection.

Texture2D Pooling
- Added EnsureTexturePool() to reuse a single Texture2D for screenshots.
- Reduces allocations and memory churn per frame.

Fill RenderTexture with GPU-Accelerated Clear
- Replaced manual GL-based color fill with Graphics.Blit and a reusable Unlit/Color shader material.
- Offloads to GPU and simplifies logic.

Combined WaitForEndOfFrame Calls
- Consolidated two yield return new WaitForEndOfFrame() calls into one in TakeScreenshot.
- Ensures all operations happen in one frame and reduces latency.

* added some inline documentation

* moved up our unity version, will need a world update before the reflections are fixed.

* improved some of the validation code, improved avatar selection panels performance hit

* one less mono

* working my way through cleaning up the basis further

* HasInstance added for virtual keyboard (stops multi spawning)

* more work needs to be done on the jiggles but slowly making a second way to set them up/

* more work on the jiggle bones script

* woops

* set active avatar SDK UXML

* added namespace

* fixed compile

* Refactor configuration mapping & Docker support. (#249)

* Refactor configuration paths to use constants for folder names and migrate legacy resource directories

* Add Docker support with configuration files and setup documentation

* Camera updates (#246)

* UI Updates

You can now close the Camera. - Sorry!
Moved FOV Slider to be more ergonomic.

* Optimizing how the Camera works

Centralized UI Panel Toggling
- Introduced a ToggleOnlyThisPanel() method with a for loop and array of all option panels.
- Reduces unnecessary SetActive(false) calls and layout rebuilds.

UI LayerMask Caching
- Cached uiLayerMask once during Awake(), removing repeated calls to LayerMask.NameToLayer("UI").
- Improves performance and ensures consistency.

Optimized RenderTexture Allocation
- SetResolution() now reuses the existing renderTexture if dimensions and format havent changed.
- Prevents expensive reallocation and garbage collection.

Texture2D Pooling
- Added EnsureTexturePool() to reuse a single Texture2D for screenshots.
- Reduces allocations and memory churn per frame.

Fill RenderTexture with GPU-Accelerated Clear
- Replaced manual GL-based color fill with Graphics.Blit and a reusable Unlit/Color shader material.
- Offloads to GPU and simplifies logic.

Combined WaitForEndOfFrame Calls
- Consolidated two yield return new WaitForEndOfFrame() calls into one in TakeScreenshot.
- Ensures all operations happen in one frame and reduces latency.

* Camera Preview & UI

Fixing the FOV Slider from being Hidden when toggling between sub-menus

Added a "Framerate Limiter" for the Image Preview, it will now use Half Framerate, rounded to 5.

* "Yuge" Camera Updates

Oh boy where do I start...

Reworked most of the UI/UX Components.
Removed all unused buttons, and replaced the most useful ones with Toggles.

PNG/EXR Toggle
Resolution 4 Stage Toggle

Added Features:
- DOF Auto
- DOF Manual
- DOF Cursor (Allowing the user to click on the screen where they'd like the DOF distance to be set
- Exposure Stops at (0.5) intervals from -3 to +3

Added Sprites:
- Cursor
- Exposure
- Nameplate2_CameraButton (a rework of version 1)
- PNG/EXR
- Resolution

Updated:
BasisUIRaycastProcess
- You only try to access [0] when the lists are not empty
- Prevents errors due to an empty raycast list
Assumptions are now Guarded! Hopefully?

New scripting logic:
PreviewClickDirect.cs
- This is the helper script for the Raycasting to determine where the user is attempting to set the DOF Distance via Cursor.

* Code Readability Refactor for Camera

Cleaned up the Initialize function
Cached Post Processing Refs

SaveSettings, ApplySettings, LoadSettings updated to reflect readability changes

Fixed Australian Typo in BasisHandHeldCamera.cs :)

When spawning a camera, it now checks if there are any other cameras, destroys said other camera and spawns a new one.

SaveSettings automatically applies during Camera Close, so when you open it, you have your settings! Yippie.

Unused Junk removal in code.

* Camera Logging - and null checks

BasisHandHeldCamera.cs:
private const reporting for duty

BASIS debug, i tried adding debugs :')

no configureawait

null checking for hit.collider, sorry, first implementation

BasisHandHeldCameraUI.cs:
Bounds checking & less repeated .length

Less errors in ApplySettings

PreviewClickDirect.cs: (Awful naming scheme)
Better debugging, sorry dooly!

BasisHamburgerMenu.cs:
Added a warning for attempting to destroy nothing

* Camera now identifies as Asynchronous

Added:
private const float RaycastMaxDistance = 1000f;
instead of creating a magic number inside the raycast.

HandHeld.SaveSettings is now async

* Camera & Personal Mirrors

Nothing like pulling your hair out!

But hey, a personal mirror :)

Move LookAction value reading from input event to Update loop for more responsive input speed.
Add tap/hold specific interactions for handling dynamic crouch.
Add guard for input lock when application is closing to avoid unecessary error logging.

Add methods for explicitly managing the movement speed and crouch amount.
Partial progress towards a consistent API structure for initialization ordering.

* Move animator driver Initialize method towards top of the class.
Remove head pause/unpause methods in favor of direct use of BasisLocks.
Remove the Update method for LocalInputActions in favor of better input event implementation logic.
Remove redundant OnMenu action, it's entirely unnecessary.

* Update any implicit transform reference to use 'this.' prefix.

* update prefab saved data.

* Switch ui enter action to find next selectable instead of just deselect.

* fixed used name

* UI Updates

You can now close the Camera. - Sorry!
Moved FOV Slider to be more ergonomic.

* Optimizing how the Camera works

Centralized UI Panel Toggling
- Introduced a ToggleOnlyThisPanel() method with a for loop and array of all option panels.
- Reduces unnecessary SetActive(false) calls and layout rebuilds.

UI LayerMask Caching
- Cached uiLayerMask once during Awake(), removing repeated calls to LayerMask.NameToLayer("UI").
- Improves performance and ensures consistency.

Optimized RenderTexture Allocation
- SetResolution() now reuses the existing renderTexture if dimensions and format havent changed.
- Prevents expensive reallocation and garbage collection.

Texture2D Pooling
- Added EnsureTexturePool() to reuse a single Texture2D for screenshots.
- Reduces allocations and memory churn per frame.

Fill RenderTexture with GPU-Accelerated Clear
- Replaced manual GL-based color fill with Graphics.Blit and a reusable Unlit/Color shader material.
- Offloads to GPU and simplifies logic.

Combined WaitForEndOfFrame Calls
- Consolidated two yield return new WaitForEndOfFrame() calls into one in TakeScreenshot.
- Ensures all operations happen in one frame and reduces latency.

* UI Updates

You can now close the Camera. - Sorry!
Moved FOV Slider to be more ergonomic.

* Optimizing how the Camera works

Centralized UI Panel Toggling
- Introduced a ToggleOnlyThisPanel() method with a for loop and array of all option panels.
- Reduces unnecessary SetActive(false) calls and layout rebuilds.

UI LayerMask Caching
- Cached uiLayerMask once during Awake(), removing repeated calls to LayerMask.NameToLayer("UI").
- Improves performance and ensures consistency.

Optimized RenderTexture Allocation
- SetResolution() now reuses the existing renderTexture if dimensions and format havent changed.
- Prevents expensive reallocation and garbage collection.

Texture2D Pooling
- Added EnsureTexturePool() to reuse a single Texture2D for screenshots.
- Reduces allocations and memory churn per frame.

Fill RenderTexture with GPU-Accelerated Clear
- Replaced manual GL-based color fill with Graphics.Blit and a reusable Unlit/Color shader material.
- Offloads to GPU and simplifies logic.

Combined WaitForEndOfFrame Calls
- Consolidated two yield return new WaitForEndOfFrame() calls into one in TakeScreenshot.
- Ensures all operations happen in one frame and reduces latency.

Fixing the FOV Slider from being Hidden when toggling between sub-menus

You can now close the Camera. - Sorry!

* Optimizing how the Camera works

Centralized UI Panel Toggling
- Introduced a ToggleOnlyThisPanel() method with a for loop and array of all option panels.
- Reduces unnecessary SetActive(false) calls and layout rebuilds.

UI LayerMask Caching
- Cached uiLayerMask once during Awake(), removing repeated calls to LayerMask.NameToLayer("UI").
- Improves performance and ensures consistency.

Optimized RenderTexture Allocation
- SetResolution() now reuses the existing renderTexture if dimensions and format havent changed.
- Prevents expensive reallocation and garbage collection.

Texture2D Pooling
- Added EnsureTexturePool() to reuse a single Texture2D for screenshots.
- Reduces allocations and memory churn per frame.

Fill RenderTexture with GPU-Accelerated Clear
- Replaced manual GL-based color fill with Graphics.Blit and a reusable Unlit/Color shader material.
- Offloads to GPU and simplifies logic.

Combined WaitForEndOfFrame Calls
- Consolidated two yield return new WaitForEndOfFrame() calls into one in TakeScreenshot.
- Ensures all operations happen in one frame and reduces latency.

* Camera Preview & UI

Fixing the FOV Slider from being Hidden when toggling between sub-menus

Added a "Framerate Limiter" for the Image Preview, it will now use Half Framerate, rounded to 5.

* Optimizing how the Camera works

Centralized UI Panel Toggling
- Introduced a ToggleOnlyThisPanel() method with a for loop and array of all option panels.
- Reduces unnecessary SetActive(false) calls and layout rebuilds.

UI LayerMask Caching
- Cached uiLayerMask once during Awake(), removing repeated calls to LayerMask.NameToLayer("UI").
- Improves performance and ensures consistency.

Optimized RenderTexture Allocation
- SetResolution() now reuses the existing renderTexture if dimensions and format havent changed.
- Prevents expensive reallocation and garbage collection.

Texture2D Pooling
- Added EnsureTexturePool() to reuse a single Texture2D for screenshots.
- Reduces allocations and memory churn per frame.

Fill RenderTexture with GPU-Accelerated Clear
- Replaced manual GL-based color fill with Graphics.Blit and a reusable Unlit/Color shader material.
- Offloads to GPU and simplifies logic.

Combined WaitForEndOfFrame Calls
- Consolidated two yield return new WaitForEndOfFrame() calls into one in TakeScreenshot.
- Ensures all operations happen in one frame and reduces latency.

* UI Updates

You can now close the Camera. - Sorry!
Moved FOV Slider to be more ergonomic.

* Optimizing how the Camera works

Centralized UI Panel Toggling
- Introduced a ToggleOnlyThisPanel() method with a for loop and array of all option panels.
- Reduces unnecessary SetActive(false) calls and layout rebuilds.

UI LayerMask Caching
- Cached uiLayerMask once during Awake(), removing repeated calls to LayerMask.NameToLayer("UI").
- Improves performance and ensures consistency.

Optimized RenderTexture Allocation
- SetResolution() now reuses the existing renderTexture if dimensions and format havent changed.
- Prevents expensive reallocation and garbage collection.

Texture2D Pooling
- Added EnsureTexturePool() to reuse a single Texture2D for screenshots.
- Reduces allocations and memory churn per frame.

Fill RenderTexture with GPU-Accelerated Clear
- Replaced manual GL-based color fill with Graphics.Blit and a reusable Unlit/Color shader material.
- Offloads to GPU and simplifies logic.

Combined WaitForEndOfFrame Calls
- Consolidated two yield return new WaitForEndOfFrame() calls into one in TakeScreenshot.
- Ensures all operations happen in one frame and reduces latency.

You can now close the Camera. - Sorry!
Moved FOV Slider to be more ergonomic.

* Optimizing how the Camera works

Centralized UI Panel Toggling
- Introduced a ToggleOnlyThisPanel() method with a for loop and array of all option panels.
- Reduces unnecessary SetActive(false) calls and layout rebuilds.

UI LayerMask Caching
- Cached uiLayerMask once during Awake(), removing repeated calls to LayerMask.NameToLayer("UI").
- Improves performance and ensures consistency.

Optimized RenderTexture Allocation
- SetResolution() now reuses the existing renderTexture if dimensions and format havent changed.
- Prevents expensive reallocation and garbage collection.

Texture2D Pooling
- Added EnsureTexturePool() to reuse a single Texture2D for screenshots.
- Reduces allocations and memory churn per frame.

Fill RenderTexture with GPU-Accelerated Clear
- Replaced manual GL-based color fill with Graphics.Blit and a reusable Unlit/Color shader material.
- Offloads to GPU and simplifies logic.

Combined WaitForEndOfFrame Calls
- Consolidated two yield return new WaitForEndOfFrame() calls into one in TakeScreenshot.
- Ensures all operations happen in one frame and reduces latency.

* Camera Preview & UI

Fixing the FOV Slider from being Hidden when toggling between sub-menus

Added a "Framerate Limiter" for the Image Preview, it will now use Half Framerate, rounded to 5.

* User Input Control Improvements (#258)

* Change crouch input action from value to button.
Add gamepad run action via left stick press.
Move LookAction value reading from input event to Update loop for more responsive input speed.
Add tap/hold specific interactions for handling dynamic crouch.
Add guard for input lock when application is closing to avoid unecessary error logging.
Add adjustable crouch.
Update animator driver to have a configurable threshold for what it considers to be crouched for handling dynamic crouch.
Update avatar eye input to use the dynamic crouch value.
Add contextual locking mechanism and update input blocks to utilize it.
Fix typo in gitignore comment.
Fix a couple initialize methods with typos.
Reorganize configuration variables for movement/crouch to handle dynamic crouch seamlessly.
Add external-read-only properties to enable auditing of the runtime data.
Add methods for explicitly managing the movement speed and crouch amount.
Partial progress towards a consistent API structure for initialization ordering.

* Move animator driver Initialize method towards top of the class.
Remove head pause/unpause methods in favor of direct use of BasisLocks.
Remove the Update method for LocalInputActions in favor of better input event implementation logic.
Remove redundant OnMenu action, it's entirely unnecessary.

* Update any implicit transform reference to use 'this.' prefix.

* update prefab saved data.

* Switch ui enter action to find next selectable instead of just deselect.

* fixed used name

author: Kitlith
message:
CI: fix failing server builds and also build the client for Linux and Android (#305)

* CI: Fix Basis Server Builds

Minor changes to make dotnet publish work in CI.
Remove extra jobs.

* CI: Refactor in prep for linux and android builds

* CI: Increase available disk space

* CI: Automatic Versioning

* CI: Build for Linux

This does dirty the tree, but only after we've extracted version
information. Not ideal, but I don't know of a better way to do it.

* CI: Build for Android

* CI: only restore cache from correct platform

given that cache for each platform takes at *minimum* 2GB,
I suspect that this will help by not accidentally duplicating
a platform's cache.

* CI: Only save cache on developer branch

* CI: don't use globs during artifact upload

They aren't having the desired effect, and I'm not sure why,
but this works correctly.

* CI: Redo release flow

* Set androidVersionCode in editor to match CI

* Document CI Secrets

author: Ha~
message:
Face tracking now networks value with largest delta instead of current value (#344)

* Try to fix resetting blendshapes was failing on obsolete SkinnedMeshRenderer references.

* Face tracking now networks value with largest delta instead of current value:
- Previously, we were networking the current value for face tracking.
- Now, we are networking the value that has the largest delta since the last networked value.
- This should make movements that only lasts a split second more likely to be visible, such as blinking, or briefly looking in a specific direction.

---------

Co-authored-by: Ha~ <hai-vr@users.noreply.github.com>

author: Ha~
message:
Remove EditorOnly objects from avatar on build and on test (#346)

Remove EditorOnly objects from avatar on build and on test:
- To line up with common avatar workflows, objects tagged EditorOnly will now be removed when building avatars, and also when pressing the Test in Editor button.
- This removal is done post-validation: Due to this, the SDK window will not show accurate information about the validity of the avatar.
- The behaviour when building scenes currently remains unchanged.

Co-authored-by: Ha~ <hai-vr@users.noreply.github.com>

author: dooly
message: removed the null checks

author: Ha~
message:
Run NDMF on Test builds and integrate NDMF cross-application builds (#348)

Run NDMF on Test builds and integrate NDMF cross-application builds:
- Pressing the "Test In Editor" button will now run non-destructive avatar tools, after all EditorOnly objects have been removed from the object.
- Integrate with NDMF's newly introduced platform-specific builds, by adding "org.basisvr.basis-framework" as the qualified name for Basis Framework avatars.
  - The class is called BasisFrameworkPlatform to follow NDMF's naming convention (INDMFPlatformProvider). Yes, we know Basis is not a platform.
- Avatars built on Basis will now only run NDMF plugins that are compatible with the Basis Framework.
- Implement NDMF's CommonAvatarInfo structure and NativeConfigData, so that "Modular Avatar for Resonite" may be used on Basis Framework avatars.

Co-authored-by: Ha~ <hai-vr@users.noreply.github.com>

author: Ha~
message:
Auto-rename duplicated humanoid bone names (#349)

* Auto-rename duplicated humanoid bone names:
- The AnimationRigging package currently has an issue: If a humanoid bone transform shares the same name as a non-humanoid bone transform inside the avatar, it will refuse to run with an error (the TransformStreamHandle cannot be resolved).
- This is an issue for avatar users, as it is extremely commonplace for bones to share the same name as a humanoid bone when merging costumes into an avatar base.
- This commit changes the behaviour when building or testing an avatar: By default, we will now detect any non-humanoid bone that shares the same name as a humanoid bone, and rename those non-humanoid bones by appending _1, _2, to its name, and so on.
- This default behaviour can be opt-out of by going to Basis Avatar component > Processing Options > Check "Do not auto-rename bones".
- The SDK will only show warnings for duplicate bone names as long as this option remains unchecked.
- A new serialized data structure has been added to Basis Avatar: BasisProcessingAvatarOptions.
- As this data structure has no use at runtime, this is set to null on the built (cloned) avatar when it finishes processing it.

* Also include the parent of the Hips bone.

---------

Co-authored-by: Ha~ <hai-vr@users.noreply.github.com>

author: Kitlith
message:
Fix linux natives (#354)

* Remove opus linux-arm64 natives

Unity (unfortunately) does not support(*) linux on arm64.
For some reason, the arm64 native was being chosen above the x64 native
when building the StandaloneLinux64 build of Basis, so let's remove it.

* Fix StandaloneLinux64 choosing x86 version of libopenvr_api.so

BasisVR/Basis#324 broke openvr for the StandaloneLinux64 build
because by adding a meta file for the x86 version of libopenvr_api.so,
it added it for consideration for inclusion with the StandaloneLinux64
build.

Fix this by telling unity to not use it for any platform.

author: Melanie Riise
message:
Experimental Persistent KV store (#376)

* feat: Experimental Persistient KV store

This adds a generic persistent kv interface for server side values. The intent is this will eventually be exposed to clients.

The current backing database is SQLite.

DATABASE STRUCTURE UNSTABLE! You may lose data until it is considered stable.

- There is no networking (clients cant use it in any way atm)
- There is no way to configure limits for buckets/keys or database settings
- Performance is not measured
- Tests are AI generated (take with a grain of salt)

* feat: kv store performance & testing
- a lot of ai generated tests.
- remove double try/catch
- sanitize prefix, make case sensitive, and sort results (ordinal).
- change how size usage is calculated.
- auto increment kv timestamp & version.
- use defer tx for read heavy tx.
- use sync transactions, microsoft reccomends against using the async apis for sqlite.
- Use a single, shared connection with a mutex. Despite having "connection pooling" for sqlite, making new connections significantly harm performance. Sqlite doesnt really allow for more than one writer anyway.

* remove caching and pooling from the connection string constructor, use pragma only

* return error on too long prefix for list keys, comment out management interface for now

* chore: cleanup .csproj

* refactor: comment out more unused things, split stat tracking to its own fn

* refactor: rename folders, namespaces, and split up KvStore into seperate files

* chore: add a few more tests

* fix for source files exporter including server only persistent KV store

Kitlith I'm sorry

---------

Co-authored-by: dooly <doolanl208@gmail.com>

author: DylanSmit
message:
Optimize scripts

Optimized Unity hierarchy calculations by combining extern transform calls. Made backwards compatible with custom defines in asmdef files for new transform API features

- Combine .position + .rotation into SetPositionAndRotation (available in all Unity versions)
- Combine .localPosition + .localRotation into SetLocalPositionAndRotation (available in newer Unity versions)
- Combine .position + .rotation into GetPositionAndRotation (available in newer Unity versions)
- Merge bool assignment from if-else to direct assignment
- Merge bool return values from if-else to direct return
- Remove unnecessary ToString() calls
- Reorder vector calculations for better performance
- Optimized string comparisons (reduced garbage allocation + faster comparison)
- Optimized stringBuilder calls
- Removed unneeded .gameObject calls on GameObject values
- Use .AddRange instead of .Add in a loop
- Use string.length instead of comparing to empty string

author: Juris S
message:
Fixing incorrect `delayCall` callback registrations

In recent Unity changes to the Scene view shortcuts, they register a method to this callback to set up the contexts of navigation shortcuts (such as WASD movement). Incorrect registrations in the code-base essentially break any form of movement in Scene view. (See: UUM-73924)

author: Casey Pugh
message:
Bug fixes (#16)

* Exclude Recording from standalone builds (UnityEditor only feature) see #15 
* Clean up issues with token sharing between Vimeo objects. Tokens are more clearly separated between vimeo player objects.
files_changed: VimeoAuth.cs; BaseEditor.cs; VimeoPlayer.cs; AudioInput.cs; CameraInput.cs; ScreenInput.cs; VideoInput.cs; RecorderController.cs; VimeoPublisher.cs; VimeoRecorder.cs; ProjectVersion.txt; README.md

author: Casey Pugh
message:
AVPro support, improved editor, and more (#20)

### VimeoPlayer
* Now compatible with [AVPro Video](http://renderheads.com/product/avpro-video/), unlocking a lot more features, most notably, adaptive/live video playback and playback support across many platforms.
* Editor lets you to pick out your Vimeo videos straight from the GUI
* Control playback from the editor
* Load in new videos from the editor when running the application
* New `Start Time` field to auto seek to a certain time code
* New `Auto Play` field to let you enable/disable autoplaying
* Added ability to synchronize the `VimeoRecorder` and `VimeoPlayer` so you can do video exporting

### VimeoRecorder
* Now compatible with [AVPro Capture](http://renderheads.com/product/av-pro-movie-capture/) (Windows-only). Great solution if you are looking for very high quality video capture.
* New `Add to Project` lets you publish videos into a specific Vimeo project.
* New `Comments` lets you enable/disable comments on your video.
* New `Downloads` lets you enable/disable the ability to let others download your video.
* New `Review Page` lets you enable/disable the ability to review your video.

### Overall improvements
* Removed the need to specify whether to save the `Vimeo Token` with the Unity scene or not. For security reasons, the token will always be stored in PlayerPrefs, but when building standalone, it will automatically add to the build. 
* General code refactoring and abstraction for easier custom scripting
* Updated README

author: Ben Yang
message:
feat: QW-4 - Replace unbounded history lists with CircularBuffer

Implements Priority 1 Quick Win #4 from framework analysis.
Eliminates memory leaks in long-running sessions by replacing
unbounded message history lists with fixed-size circular buffers.

**Changes:**
- Created CircularBuffer<T> generic class with O(1) operations
- Replaced messageInList/messageOutList with CircularBuffer instances
- Added configurable messageHistorySize field (10-10000, default 100)
- Removed manual list truncation code (automatic overflow handling)
- Added comprehensive unit tests (25+ test cases)
- Updated framework analysis task checklist

**Performance Impact:**
- Fixed memory footprint (no growth over time)
- O(1) add operation (previously O(n) with RemoveAt)
- Configurable via Unity Inspector

**Testing:**
- CircularBufferTests.cs covers wrapping, enumeration, edge cases
- Compatibility with List.Insert(0, item) pattern verified
- Performance tests validate O(1) behavior

**Files Modified:**
- Assets/MercuryMessaging/Protocol/MmRelayNode.cs
- Assets/MercuryMessaging/Support/Data/CircularBuffer.cs (NEW)
- Assets/MercuryMessaging/Tests/CircularBufferTests.cs (NEW)
- dev/active/framework-analysis/framework-analysis-tasks.md
files_changed: MmRelayNode.cs; CircularBuffer.cs; CircularBuffer.cs.meta; Tests.meta; CircularBufferTests.cs; CircularBufferTests.cs.meta; framework-analysis-tasks.md

refactor: Convert Quick Win tests to Unity Test Framework

  * CircularBufferMemoryTests.cs - QW-4 validation (6 tests)
  * HopLimitValidationTests.cs - QW-1 hop limits (6 tests)
  * CycleDetectionValidationTests.cs - QW-1 cycle detection (6 tests)
  * LazyCopyValidationTests.cs - QW-2 optimization (7 tests)

- Removed UI-based test infrastructure:
  * Deleted TestManagerScript, TestResultDisplay, QuickWinConfigHelper
  * Deleted old test scripts (CircularBufferMemoryTest, HopLimitTest, etc.)
  * Deleted QuickWinValidation.unity scene
  * Removed Testing folder entirely

- Updated documentation:
  * Added Testing section to CLAUDE.md with test execution instructions
  * Updated framework-analysis-tasks.md to reflect completed refactoring
  * Archived old scene documentation to dev/archive/quick-win-scene/

Benefits:
- Tests run from Unity Test Runner (Window > General > Test Runner)
- No manual scene setup required
- Professional NUnit test structure
- CI/CD ready (command-line execution supported)
- 25 automated tests covering all Quick Win implementations

Run tests: Unity Editor > Window > General > Test Runner > PlayMode > Run All

author: Ben Yang
message:
perf: Optimize performance test infrastructure

Remove debug overhead causing 6.5x frame time regression. Performance
Mode disables UpdateMessages() tracking during tests. Fixed rate limiting
and memory leak in message generation.

Key Changes:
- Add PerformanceMode flag to MmRelayNode (disables debug tracking)
- Replace WaitForSeconds with frame-based accumulator in MessageGenerator
- Fix messageBuffer memory leak (clear when > 1000 items)
- Reduce GC.GetTotalMemory() sampling frequency (60x less)
- Add burst mode option for stress testing

Bottlenecks Fixed:
1. UpdateMessages() debug overhead: 15-20ms/frame  0ms (50-60% reduction)
2. WaitForSeconds coroutine delays: Eliminated with frame-based generation
3. messageBuffer unbounded growth: Now cleared periodically
4. GC.GetTotalMemory() overhead: Sampled every 60 frames instead of every frame

Expected Performance Improvement:
- Frame time: 32-36ms  5-16ms (3-6x faster)
- Throughput: 28-30 msg/sec  100-500 msg/sec (3-17x faster)
- Memory: Leak fixed, stable growth
- Cache hit rate: Now properly measurable

Files Modified:
- Assets/MercuryMessaging/Protocol/MmRelayNode.cs
- Assets/MercuryMessaging/Tests/Performance/Scripts/MessageGenerator.cs
- Assets/MercuryMessaging/Tests/Performance/Scripts/PerformanceTestHarness.cs

Next Step: Rebuild test scenes and run validation tests

message:
fix: Resolve all 42 Unity compilation errors in tests and tutorials

Fixed access modifiers, property accessibility, and MmMetadataBlock
constructor calls across 3 files to eliminate all compilation errors.

Changes:
- T4_ModernCylinderResponder.cs:26: protected  public override Awake()
- MmExtendableResponderTests.cs:54: Added public setter for InitializeCalled
- MmExtendableResponderIntegrationTests.cs: Fixed 8 MmMetadataBlock constructors
  * Changed enum references to helper class constants
  * Moved tag parameter to first position (tag-first constructor overload)
  * Fixed lines: 109-114, 130-135, 151-156, 172-177, 204-209, 232-237, 258-263, 280-285

Technical Details:
- MmMetadataBlock has two constructors: (level, active, selected, network)
  and (tag, level, active, selected, network). Tests were passing tag as
  5th param instead of 1st param.
- Helper classes (MmLevelFilterHelper, MmTagHelper) provide constants,
  while enums (MmLevelFilter, MmTag) are actual types used in constructors.

Testing:
- EditMode tests: 4/4 passing
- All compilation errors resolved (verified via Unity console)

Updated dev/TECHNICAL_DEBT.md to document fixes and remaining work:
- Priority 4 (commented debug code): Already complete
- Priority 3 (FSM tests): Documented as 2-4h task for separate session

author: Ben Yang
message:
revert: Remove incorrectly written FSM state transition tests

The FsmStateTransitionTests.cs file was written with fundamental API
mismatches that resulted in 40+ compilation errors. The test file made
incorrect assumptions about:

1. InitializeFSM() method - doesn't exist, FSM created in Awake()
2. RespondersFSM.JumpTo() signature - expects MmRoutingTableItem not MmRelayNode
3. FiniteStateMachine.isTransitioning - property doesn't exist
4. Direct state access - must use RoutingTable[node] lookup

Root Cause:
Tests were written without verifying actual API signatures in:
- MmRelaySwitchNode.cs (lines 70-86, 115-128)
- FiniteStateMachine.cs

Resolution:
Removing test file entirely. FSM testing remains as technical debt item
in TECHNICAL_DEBT.md (Priority 3).

Reverts commits:
- 37f5f601 test: Add comprehensive FSM state transition tests
- d8d8ef4d fix: Correct FSM test helper classes
- 38310b37 fix: Use correct MmInvoke signature

author: Ben Yang
message:
feat(dsl): Complete DSL Overhaul Phase 1 - Unified Messaging API

Implements Two-Tier API for both MmRelayNode and MmBaseResponder:

Tier 1 (Auto-Execute):
- BroadcastInitialize(), BroadcastRefresh(), BroadcastSetActive()
- BroadcastSwitch(), BroadcastValue(bool/int/float/string)
- NotifyComplete(), NotifyValue(bool/int/float/string)

Tier 2 (Fluent Chain):
- responder.Send(value).ToDescendants().Execute()
- Full routing control from responders

Key Changes:
- Add MmMessagingExtensions.cs (unified API, ~280 lines)
- Add MmMessagingExtensionsTests.cs (~27 tests)
- Remove dead code from MmRelayNode (messageBuffer, colorA-D)
- Fix extension method ambiguity (remove duplicates)
- Update CLAUDE.md and DSL_API_GUIDE.md with unified API docs
- Archive standard-library task (merged into phases 9-10)

Breaking Changes:
- BroadcastInitialize/BroadcastRefresh removed from MmFluentExtensions
- BroadcastSetActive/NotifyComplete removed from MmRelayNodeExtensions
- Use MmMessagingExtensions equivalents instead

Tests: Run manually via Window > Test Runner > PlayMode

author: Ben Yang
message:
perf(serialize): Remove LINQ Concat().ToArray() from all message types

Phase 3 of performance optimization - eliminates LINQ allocations from
Serialize() methods across all 13 message type classes.

Changes:
- Replace .Concat().ToArray() with pre-allocated arrays + Array.Copy()
- Add BASE_SERIALIZED_SIZE constant (8) to MmMessage for size calculation
- Fix O(n)  O(n) complexity in MmMessageByteArray and MmMessageTransformList
- Remove System.Linq using statements from all modified files

Bug Fixes (pre-existing in MmMessagePool.cs):
- Add missing using MercuryMessaging.Task for IMmSerializable
- Fix MmMetadataBlock.Default  new MmMetadataBlock()
- Fix MmMessageTransformList.MmTransformList  transforms
- Fix MmMessageGameObject.value  Value (casing)

Files modified (13 message types + 1 pool + docs):
- Protocol/Message/MmMessage.cs (base class)
- Protocol/Message/MmMessage{Bool,Int,Float,String,Vector3}.cs
- Protocol/Message/MmMessage{Vector4,Quaternion,Transform}.cs
- Protocol/Message/MmMessage{ByteArray,TransformList,Serializable,GameObject}.cs
- Protocol/Core/MmMessagePool.cs (bug fixes only)

Performance impact: Reduces per-message allocations from 3+ to 1,
eliminates iterator overhead, and fixes quadratic complexity in
variable-length message serialization.
files_changed: MmMessagePool.cs; MmMessage.cs; MmMessageBool.cs; MmMessageByteArray.cs; MmMessageFloat.cs; MmMessageGameObject.cs; MmMessageInt.cs; MmMessageQuaternion.cs; MmMessageSerializable.cs; MmMessageString.cs; MmMessageTransform.cs; MmMessageTransformList.cs; MmMessageVector3.cs; MmMessageVector4.cs; SESSION_HANDOFF_2025-11-25.md

author: Ben Yang
message:
feat(perf): Phase 2 - O(1) routing table lookup with Dictionary indices

Optimizes MmRoutingTable with O(1) Dictionary-based lookups:

Implementation:
- Add _nameIndex and _responderIndex Dictionary fields
- Lazy initialization via EnsureIndicesInitialized()
- Automatic index maintenance on Add/Remove/Insert/Clear
- Handle duplicate names (first occurrence indexed)
- O(1) Contains() via responder index lookup

Performance improvement:
- Lookup by name: O(n)  O(1)
- Lookup by responder: O(n)  O(1)
- Contains check: O(n)  O(1)

Tests:
- 12 unit tests for correctness and index maintenance
- Performance validation tests confirming O(1) behavior

Also fixes: Remove invalid MercuryMessaging.Protocol.Core namespace
import from DSL extension files.

author: Ben Yang
message:
feat(dsl): Complete Phase 2.1 - Listener Pattern for message subscription

Implements the fluent Listener API for receiving messages from external
components without creating full responders.

Core Features:
- Listen<T>() for typed message subscription
- ListenOnce<T>() for one-time handlers with auto-disposal
- When() and WithTag() filters for conditional handling
- Convenience methods: OnFloat(), OnInt(), OnString(), etc.
- Method listeners: OnInitialize(), OnSetActive(), OnSwitch(), etc.

Responder Support (Option 1 - unified API):
- All Listen methods work on BOTH MmRelayNode AND MmBaseResponder
- Responder extensions delegate to relay node with null-safety
- Matches established pattern from MmMessagingExtensions.cs

Infrastructure (MmRelayNode):
- _listeners registry with lazy initialization
- AddListener<T>(), RemoveListener<T>(), ClearListeners()
- NotifyListeners() integrated into MmInvoke() flow
- Backwards iteration for safe removal during notification

Tests: 26 unit tests covering:
- Basic registration/disposal (Tests 1-4)
- One-time listeners (Tests 5-6)
- Filtering with When/WithTag (Tests 7-9)
- Convenience methods (Tests 10-16)
- Cleanup and edge cases (Tests 17-19)
- Responder extensions (Tests 20-26)
files_changed: MmListener.cs; MmListener.cs.meta; MmListenerExtensions.cs; MmListenerExtensions.cs.meta; MmRelayNode.cs; MmListenerTests.cs; MmListenerTests.cs.meta

author: Ben Yang
message:
feat(dsl): Phase 2.5 & 2.6 - Runtime Registration and Tag Configuration

Phase 2.5: Runtime Registration Extensions (MmRoutingExtensions.cs)
- RegisterWith() - Single-line child registration (was 2 lines)
- RegisterChildren() - Bulk registration with params array
- UnregisterFrom()/UnregisterChildren() - Clean unregistration
- HasParents()/GetFirstParent()/IsRoot() - Hierarchy queries
- Automatic FSM rebuild on MmRelaySwitchNode registration

Phase 2.6: Tag Configuration DSL (MmTagExtensions.cs)
- WithTag()/WithTags() - Fluent tag assignment
- AddTag()/RemoveTag()/ClearTags() - Tag manipulation
- HasTag()/HasAllTags()/HasAnyTag() - Tag queries
- EnableTagChecking()/DisableTagChecking() - Filter control
- ConfigureTags() builder for bulk tag operations on hierarchies

Both phases include comprehensive unit tests.

User Avatar Input Spawning

Added an event that notifies the outside world that input controls have been spawned. This allows for other objects to easily execute functionality when input controls are spawned.

Remove NetworkRigidbody Sensitivity

Removed the sensitivity from network rigidbodies, now every change to velocity or angular velocity is synchronized.

author: Joshua Dahl
message:
Offset on Ownership Tweaks

Offset on Ownership now moves transforms instead of SyncPoses. It is now intended to offset child objects.

author: Joshua Dahl

Remove Input Control Linker

The input control linker is unessicary, it current role can be filled by checking if the targetAvatar is null or a prefab and replacing it with the UserAvatar in a parent.

files_changed: Daniel_Test_Realm.unity; MonitorMode.cs; monitor_new.fbx; monitor_new.fbx.meta; ProjectSettings.asset; ProjectVersion.txt

author: Daniel James
message:
Locked camera, added keyboard support

The player's up and down camera movement is now limited (via vertical
clamping in the FPSController) to get rid of the bug where the player
can fly by placing a box directly underneath themself. Added WASD
support for puzzle one and two. It gets really janky on my laptop
though. GetKey is probably not the best way to do it.
files_changed: v0.1.1.unity; MonitorMode.cs; PuzzleOne.cs; PuzzleTwo.cs; FPSController.prefab; ProjectSettings.asset; ProjectVersion.txt

author: Daniel James
message:
Fixed colour counts

Sped up movement speed when using WASD because I'm getting annoyed with
how slow it is after doing it 8 thousand times.

Fixed the distance measurements -- was doing the if statements in the
wrong order so it was only calculating when monitorMode == true

Fixed the colour counts. TODO: right now they all start as 3 until you
hover over that light and then it jumps back to 0. Not sure why.

author: danielcolinjames
message:
Made puzzle three logic dynamic

Used an array of boxes for each colour instead of hard coding each box.
Deleted a lot of redundant code. Now if we want to add or remove boxes
from that puzzle, we just have to add them into the scene and give them
the right tag.

The represenation on the monitor is also now dynamic based on the number
of boxes in the scene and how many have been placed on their goal.

Boxes also now disappear when placed on a goal.

the actual warehouse (with a new camera above: easier than
programatically changing the monitor camera's size I think)
- re-ordered everything so that when the lights come back on, it now
jumps to the knocking boxes down puzzle, and when that puzzle is
finished, it jumps to the conveyor belt puzzle
- small fix for PickupObject: dropping was broken
- removed XInputDotNetPure package because it was making it impossible
to export to .exe
- started on script to make security cameras rotate back and forth

C# class to enable testing, since there was no
reason for it to be a MonoBehaviour.

singleton G, like so: G.Instance.ProgressManager.

Refactoring of ProgressManager included changing
fields to properties and removing getter methods.

message:
Finished ElementFramework

Finished making the elements spawn each other properly, now im working on making a ui to properly choose and manipulate the elements to help the user keep the screen organized as they forge the chemicals.

author: Princegaming33
message:
UI Almost done

Finished all the delete element bugs, you can now delete any element apart of any string of bonds and it works seamlessly.
Also finished the organize button that allows you to drag already instantiated elements to where you want them.
Wrote up some intro text to describe the controls of the game. Might put them at the very beginning in case anyone knows the science but forgot the controls. Last bug I can see on the UI front is the element selection is off by 1 box for some reason.

author: Princegaming33
message:
Dialed in bug and finishing up small ui things

After about an hour of experimenting i found out the bug that makes buttons link to each other is based on a TextMeshProUGUI child, so i have removed it and am going to schedule a meeting with someone I know know's unity better than me to see if we can solve it. Other than that, I made all the elements different colors, based on the base game's colors for them and added a small text at the top of the screen that displays what the target molecule the minigame wants the user to make.

author: HansMoleman69
message:
Implement SV2Status Parameter Update from Button Interaction

Implemented SV2ButtonControl script for toggling SV2 status based on button material.
Integrated SV2ButtonControl script with ControllerCubeBehaviour and NPPSystemInterface to manipulate SV2 status in the simulation.
Updated NPPSimulationAnimationBehaviour to read and apply the updated SV2 status to the Animator Controller's parameter.
Added a "WallText" element to serve as a label above the SV2 button.
Troubleshooting and debugging completed for the button interaction, color change, and SV2 status update functionalities.
Removed obsolete files SliderAnimatorController and SliderController.
All changes tested successfully.

    Implemented Animation Controller for NPP Simulation

    Implemented the NPPSimulationAnimatorController and NPPSimulationAnimationBehaviour classes to animate the state transitions based on the statuses of the simulation components.
    Attached these animation components to the ControllerCube GameObject.
    Debugged an issue where SV2 wasn't accessible from ControllerCubeBehaviour. It now correctly accesses the status of SV2 through the getNPPSystemInterface().getSV2Status() method.
    Tested the transition to SV2 open state in the Animator Controller by manually setting SV2Status parameter to true. The state machine transitions to the expected state."

author: HansMoleman69
message:
Enhancement of NPPSimulationAnimation Behaviour and Controller

This update introduces several enhancements to our Nuclear Power Plant (NPP) simulation:

All relevant parameters have been added to the NPPSimulationAnimatorController. These parameters provide a holistic view of the plant's status and are essential for the accurate representation of the simulation.

The NPPSimulationAnimationBehaviour script has been updated to maintain the correct state of all parameters. This script ensures that the visual representation of the plant in our simulation is in sync with the underlying data model at all times.

All relevant states for the plant's startup procedures have been defined. These states map to the real-life operations that a plant undergoes during its startup phase, ensuring that our simulation accurately mimics the behavior of a real power plant.

All transitions along with their respective conditions have been added. This allows the simulation to accurately move from one state to another based on the status of various parameters. It adds a layer of interactivity and dynamism to our simulation, making it more engaging and informative.

author: Stephen Hodgson
message:
Package and symbolic link utilities (#71)

* updated async awaiters with static values for better perf and less memory allocations.
updated async process extensions and added an additional process extension for synchronous processes
* updated gltf importers with updated async stuff and fixed a few typos and namespaces for importers
* added some string extensions.
* a bit of misc cleanup of empty classes and malformed namespaces
* added symbolic link wizard
* remove symbolic link from settings file if it cannot be found.
* updated logging to better show when links are removed if neither the source nor target paths can be found.
* copied the symbolic link list before iterating over them so we don't modify the real list when processing them.
* a bit of cleanup
* Added WMR and SDK submodules to project
* Revert "Added WMR and SDK submodules to project"
* This reverts commit 11b955769ecf8377420cf31ca54809f59e0d984f.
* added wmr submodule
* Added sdk submodule
* removed sdk submodule due to weird path name
* added SDK submodule back in
* Fixed saving symbolic link asset. 
* cleaned up RunSync a bit
* symbolic link upm package interchange
* updated wmr and sdk package version numbers
* added batching logging for package utility and made sure to update properly
* added warning about missing symlink settings asset
* ensure that the symbolic linker runs before attempting to update any upm packages
* delayed the call to the initial sync of the linker until after all inspectors have updated at least once.
* added warning when sync runs and auto load is enabled but no settings are found

author: Dino Fejzagic
message:
Feature/diagnostics system port (#156)

* Remove [HideInInspector] attribute for CanvasUtility canvas field

Hiding the field from the inspector makes it impossible to set the canvas in editor,
which is generally ok, but the Awake method is checking whether canvas is null before getting it.
Since it cannot be set in inspector this if will also be true.

* Commit submodules

* Port latst DiagnosticsSystem updates from MRTK

Mainly adjusting namespaces and class names that have changed. Added the visual profile component
which replaces the DiagnosticsHandler that used to live in XRTK/SDK.

* Fix DiagnosticsService constructor params

* Fix asset menu path to create diagnostics profile

* Resolve PR review comments

* removed a bunch of stuff that wasn't used anymore.
cleaned up the system and visualizer classes a bit

* removed stray meta

* Update XRTK-Core/Packages/com.xrtk.core/Services/DiagnosticsSystem/MixedRealityDiagnosticsSystem.cs

* Add missing shader for visual profiler

author: Dino Fejzagi
message:
Remove internal flag on parent profile property (#875)

# XRTK - Mixed Reality Toolkit Pull Request

## Overview

Removed the `internal` keyword on the `BaseMixedRealityProfile.ParentProfile` property setter. This was necessary to be able to set parent profiles  in code that lives in another assembly.

author: Simon (Darkside) Jackson
message:
Updated Camera validation (#919)

* Move Camera rig validation to the Validate function

* Updated validation to use Public property

* Moved the Camera rig setup/validation to Enable
Fixed an issue where the tracking setup did not allow for the Editor having NO tracking type

* Updated "MixedRealityToolkit -> Configure.." to ensure a XRCameraRig exists when called.

* Fixed Random bug where the Locomotion system would create a new camera via calling CameraCache.Main in the OnDestroy loop

**Note, NEVER use CameraCache.Main in OnDestroy, or ALWAYS check Camera.main is not null FIRST

* Moved Camera validation to Toolkit Validation
Ensured toolkit requirements are ONLY validation if there is an active profile (stopped Sooooo many errors)
Updated warning on the Camera Rig validation message

* Reverted some changes to ensure tests pass and changed some assumptions
Reverted "editor" changed to CameraDataProvider Tracking check.
On investigation, the Mock HMD reports as a System which has an unknown tracking type, which the current functionality incorrectly reports as a failure.

Needs further investigation.

* Addressed feedback

* Fix typo

* Fixed the blocking issue.  "SetupTrackingOrigin" now identifies the MockHMD type and sets the height accordingly.

* Fixed formatting
Added Toolkit definition for the Default Camera Rig name, applied it to all places validating or creating the Default Camera Rig

* fixed some typos

fixed some formatting
removed camera pose driver assert to remove warning when entering play mode

author: Samuel325
message:
Inventory System Update

Added the UI for the inventory system. Can be brought up by pressing the A button or the X button on the Quest Controller. Inventory shows up as a list of items where clicking on them spawns the item in front of the player. Adding items to inventory could be done by grabbing the item and moving it behind your head. When shooting with the gun, UI now displays how many seeds the player has in their inventory (could be revamped later). When reloading, seed ammo is removed from inventory and added to gun based on the remaining or max ammo.

author: SkyFewkes
message:
Update projectile tags and pool manager objects

Fixed the Ally Power Up to work now: Removed the respawn timer logic so you have to force it to spawn itself and it will active a Empty that will host the ally turrets and start shooting at enemies to help the player. Duped the old powerup Mat so its green.

Updated the Ally turret perfab and script to now play sound when shooting and updated the logic so it is more random when shooting to make it more unique, to not have both turrets shooting at the same time.

Fixed some Bugs: Changed the CannonBall prefab by adding a 'PlayerShot' tag to it. Then changing some logic to check for this tag (like in the powerups), instead of checking the name of the object (so its now easier to switch out the cannon with a new model without breaking much).
And Expanded the PoolManager prefab inside the main game sense to include the projectiles the allies shoot.

Kazadan beri babannesiyle birlikte yaayan sarah 8 yana gelene kadar babaneesinin evinden dar admn atmam komular olan Lisa hari hi arkada olmamt. 8 yanda babaannesinin de lmesiyle tek arkada olan Lisa hari kimsesi kalmayan Sarah aylarca eve kapanm ve delirmeye balamtr. Her gece evden geceleri gelen lklar zerine Lisa ailesiyle sarah kontrol etmek iin Sarah'n yaadklar eve ziyarette bulunmak isterler. Evin kapsn aldklarnda aan olmamtr ve kap zaten kilitli deildir. Saraha seslenerek eve girerler ve ykk dkk evin ierisindeki  youn kokudan zorla ilerlemektedirler. author: Florian Spiess
message:
Pose Query UI (#12)

* Implemented basic term selection functionality.

Map term provider currently broken, error on instantiation of main
map.

* Added extra scene to allow testing without VR.

Added PreconfiguredInputScene to replace ModularInputScene for testing on conventional 2D displays.

* Adjusted preconfigured term placement.

* Implemented first test version of pose query UI.

* Completed basic pose skeleton.

Added missing pose skeleton points for the MSCOCO pose skeleton.

* Added canvas scale handle.

Added canvas scale handle to make canvas scalable and improve usability
while projection is orthogonal.

* Adjusted default pose connections.

* Implemented rudimentary line projections.

* Updated pose formulation.

- Refactored pose canvas to allow multiple poses at the same time.
- Implemented pose key point activation and deactivation.
- Implemented pose term generation.

* Created pose term provider selection.

* Updated canvas scale handle to scale more intuitively.

* Implemented adding of new pose skeletons.

* Improved pose query formulation.

- Implemented moving of entire pose skeleton.
- Implemented removing of pose query term.

* Implemented basic pose skeleton destruction.

- Fixed null interactables not being correctly removed from interactor.
- Implemented destruction of pose skeleton through interacting with the
  center.

* Implemented pose term provider returning no terms when there are no pose skeletons.

* Implemented perspective pose projection.

* Updated pose term provider to flip y coordinates to conform to the correct coordinate origin.

message:
Upgrade logging (#18)

* Updated DRES results logging to include stage index for staged queries.

* Fixed bug logging object as segment query results.

* Refactored results logging from DresClientManager to a new logging class separating file and DRES logging.

* Refactored submission logging and fixed fast file logging through semaphores.

* Refactored interaction logging.

Moved interaction logging functions to LoggingController.
Removed all file logging from DresClientManager.

* Implemented more fine grained custom interaction logging category enum.

* Implemented logging to file of source calling class.

* Upgraded to Cineast API version 0.1.0.

author: Florian Spiess
message:
Enhanced Object Query View (#20)

* Refactored object query display to allow quicker instantiation of results.

- Removed prefetch configuration option as batched data fetching scales very well in comparison to individual fetching.
- Implemented grouping of results before creation of displays to allow faster instantiation.

* Improved CylinderObjectQueryDisplay instantiation method.

* Removed debug log.

* Seperated UI dropdown including UI blocker workaround to a prefab.

* Changed query view selection to drop down.

* Implemented drawer like object results inspection.

* Minor fixes and documentation.

* Update readme with Whisper setup instructions

author: tterpi
message:
Major refactor.

Control point class introduced that holds parameters and tangent calculation logic. Spline class now uses list of control points.
Currently only the complete spline can be calculated. Logic for manipulating and adding single control points without recalculating the entire spline is todo.
files_changed: InterpolatedLine.cs; KochanekBartelsControlPoint.cs; KochanekBartelsControlPoint.cs.meta; KochanekBartelsInterpolation.cs; KochanekBartelsSpline.cs; KochanekBartelsSpline.cs.meta; manifest.json; EditorSettings.asset; ProjectVersion.txt

author: tterpi
message:
Refactoring line extrusion.

New LineExtruder class was created that is used in ExtrusionTest. The
new class now holds all meshing code.

author: tterpi
message:
Changed the interpolation to remove duplicate points.

The duplicate points were causing issues with the mesh generation. The
problem now is that the last control point of the spline is not being
reached. The line ends one interpolation step before the last
control point.

author: tterpi
message:
Last segment of spline now reaches last control point.

Calculation of the last segment was changed to reach the position of the
last control point. Before it would end one interpolated point before because
the first point of the next segment would be at the position and the
last segment was not treated differently.
Also refactored the method getControlPointsForSegment.

author: tterpi
message:
SplineMesh can now be instantiated with a ITubeMesh object.

Refactored SplineMesh to no longer hold copies of the mesh cross
section. Only TubeMeshes hold this data now. Added a CrossSection class
containing vertices, normals and scale of a cross section. ITubeMesh now
requieres methods for getting and setting cross sections and TubeMesh
and ParallelTransportTubeMesh implement this. LineSketchObject still
uses the default contructor of SplineMesh which uses TubeMesh.

author: tterpi
message:
Refactored the deserialization of a sketch to make it...

easier to extend. The data class for each type of ISerializableComponent
now knows the prefab to instantiate when it is deserialized. This means
that the SketchObjectGroup class no longer has to be changed when a new
type of SketchObject is implemented. Only a data class has to be
created.

author: John Bacho
message:
Added Wavepoints for camera to move towards

Added VRCameraMover script for dynamic camera movement in VR.

Located under Main Camera (and in the Scripts folder).
    To use:
   - Create a new empty object and place it to where you want the camera to go
   - Select the Main Camera and drag the empty object into the Waypoints list.
   - Adjust the order as needed.
   - Set Movement Speed, Rotation Speed, and optional Wait Time at Start.
   - Add custom Wait Times for each waypoint if necessary.

author: John Bacho
message:
Changes

Made the cube grid 5 by 5 for a total of 25 cubes. Cube headers is now adaptable to the amount cubes ie will add more or less cubes to the header of the file based on the length of cubes array. ButtonPressed function now takes in a bool array so that it is now adaptable. Unity was bitching so I added in some code that cleans up the preview render. Display Pattern now just takes in pattern1 instead of a whole new bool array simplifying the architecture.

author: John Bacho
message:
Updated Backend

The golden rule of programming is to never mess with code that works and that's exactly what I did. Added in the CheckFocusedObject() to the backend of SXR. Problem was that there where discrepancies between the mainfile and the eyetracker files as in there would be hundreds if not thousands of lines missing from the mainfile that were in the eyetracker. So we now save "GazeHitPointX,GazeHitPointY,GazeHitPointZ,GameObjectInFocus" into the eyetracker file now without parentheses. Will soon be updating other scripts to remove checkfocus from them.
